Despite obstacles and the lack of economic resources, they’ve moved forward and hope to give their children the education they did not have the chance to complete.

Mónica lives in El Pacto in a parish in Quito Canton located in Pichincha Province in the Republic of Ecuador.  Pacto is located in the northwestern part of Quito Metropolitan District.  Its history started in the Pre-Inca period and its name comes from the pacts reached between important political parties.  As for its economy, it’s an agricultural and animal husbandry zone due to its climate and geography which results in harvests of crops from both the coastal and the mountain regions.  Its residents live day to day from these activities.  Even though it’s a place that’s far from the city, there are families that have started all sorts of activities to cover their needs and those of their community.

Mónica has been working growing sugarcane for six years.  She works 10 hours daily in this activity caring for, watering and harvesting crops.  She learned this activity from her parents and then with the experience she acquired.  Mónica is a very enterprising young woman who is motivated to get ahead through her own devices, for her children and for her family.  Her sister’s help has been of great support in getting her business going in addition to her spouse’s support.  

Mónica hopes to prepare herself to better manage her business and hopes to increase income producing larger crop yields and also supplies to adequately care for the already existing crops so as not to have any losses.

Fundación Alternativa has provided this tenacious woman with a loan to buy seeds and the necessary supplies to start this new step towards increasing business and as a result to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 32-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for six years and her business is located on a busy street, thus attracting many customers. Aida also sells timber and does farming for additional income. Aida is requesting a loan to buy cassava flour to sell. Her business plan is to sell wholesale and to open two more outlets in the nearby trading centers. As a good mother, she desires to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmeen is a 45-year-old married woman who has been selling used clothes for ten years. She purchases bundles of sweaters, shirts and trousers from the market at wholesale rates, cleans and presses the clothes and then sells them in her community. Ms. Yasmeen offers a variety of clothes to her customers in various colors and designs. She earns enough through her business to lead a decent life.

Ms. Yasmeen is a loving mother of three children. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. Ms. Yasmeen has steadily improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. She has now requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy stock of winter sweaters and shirts in various designs. Ms. Yasmeen hopes to have more profits and hence better support for her family.

loans.use: To buy stock of winter sweaters and shirts in various designs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 26 years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is married and has two children. Rosemarie cultivates bananas and coconuts for sale and earns PHP 4,000 each month doing this kind of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Rosemarie has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She hopes to provide the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, for her banana and coconut trees.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia is a 43 year old woman who lives in a rented house in Kawempe, a city out-skirts suburb, with her husband, who is a driver, and four school going children. She earns a living by collecting and buying metal scrap which she sells to metal recyclists. Proscovia has successfully serviced a loan of 300,000 UGX from UGAFODE (MDI) LTD, which she used to expand her business into two collection centers and also to partly pay her children’s school fees. 
She has now applied for a second loan of 500,000 UGX to buy more scrap for increased profits. She is confident that with the help from UGAFODE her business will grow steadily and her standards of living will improve. In the photo is Proscovia and her UGAFODE credit officer, who had gone for field verification at her scrap business.

loans.use: To buy metal scrap

loans.name: Fantasticas - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento FANTASTICAS – 32 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Marisol  tiene 29 años y tiene un hijo de la edad de 5 años, la Sra. Marisol se dedica a la venta de perfumes tiene una perfumería en la zona de Cala Cala desde hace un año, no es mucho tiempo pero ella está feliz ya que tiene clientela,   este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Marisol va a usar este préstamo para la compra de perfumes por mayor y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos  a sus clientes,  ya que esta época de fin de año es donde tiene mas demanda ya que mucha gente compra perfumes para regalar en esta Navidad y ella quiere aprovechar esta demanda y así también genera más ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The “Fantásticas-32” communal bank has 8 members, seven women and one man.  The bank president is Marisol, 29.  She has a five-year-old son and she works selling perfume.  She has had a perfume shop in the Cala Cala zone for a year.  It’s not a very long time but she’s happy because she already has a good clientele.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution and Marisol will use the loan to buy perfume at wholesale in order to have a wide variety available for her customers since demand is higher during the end-of-year season because many people buy perfume to give away as Christmas gifts and she wants to take advantage of this demand to generate higher income.

loans.use: to buy perfume at wholesale.

loans.name: Dúo Salmo 121 Group

texts.es:
DUO SALMO 121
Doña Jesus es originaria de San Jose Poaquil ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras  desde hace años ella viene realizando esta actividad ya que es el único medio que ha tenido para salir adelante.
Ella tiene un pequeño local en el mercado municipal de San Jose Poaquil donde ofrece una variedad de frutas y verduras a su clientela gracias a Dios ahora ya es bien conocida por sus clientes donde lo visitan todos los días.
Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y gracias al apoyo de el ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que con el apoyo de el ella se motiva para seguir realizando sus actividades.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Psalm 121 Duo

Jesús is from San José Poaquil and has worked selling fruit and vegetables for years; it’s her only means of getting ahead.  She has a small stand in the San José municipal market where she sells a variety of fruit and vegetables.  Thanks to God she’s well-known by her customers who visit her daily.  Her husband works in agriculture and thanks to his support, she’s able to continue forward with her business because with his support she’s motivated to continue carrying out her activities.  Her dream is to expand the business more to offer more variety of products to her customers so that she can earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Pantaleon

texts.en: Pantaleon, 49 years old, is married and has two young children, 5 and 7 years old.  He is from Talibon, Bohol. Pantaleon has been engaged in a farming business for 2 years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 PHP. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and medicine to make his crops healthy. In the future, Pantaleon dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicine

loans.name: Silvia Margoth

texts.es:
Silvia es una mujer de 32 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos Richard de 17 años, Pablo de 13 años y Mayte de 9 años. A pesar de los obstáculos y la falta de recursos económicos ellos han salido adelante y Silvia espera dar a sus hijos la educación que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar, pues solo alcanzó a terminar sus estudios de la escuela primaria. Silvia vive con su hijos en el Pacto una parroquia del Cantón Quito ubicado en la Provincia de Pichincha en la República del Ecuador. Pacto está ubicado en el noroccidente del Distrito Metropolitano de Quito, su historia inicia en la época preincaica y su nombre se deriva de acuerdos realizados entre partidos políticos importantes. En cuanto a su economía, es una zona agrícola y ganadera, debido a su situación climática y geográfica, lo cual también produce efecto en las cosechas de las cuales se obtiene productos de la Región Costa como de la Región Sierra. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Silvia se dedica a la producción de caña de azúcar desde hace 13 años, en esta actividad trabaja 10 horas diarias, cuidando, regando y cosechando los cultivos, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre y luego con la experiencia que fue adquiriendo. Silvia es una mujer muy emprendedora y motivada a seguir adelante siempre por ella, por sus hijos, por su familia. El trabajo lo realiza con la ayuda de su hermana y también de sus hijos. Silvia anhela prepararse para manejar de mejor forma su negocio, para lo cual espera incrementar sus ingresos con la producción mayor de cultivos y además insumos para el cuidado adecuado de los ya existentes para así no sufrir pérdidas. Fundación Alternativa ha facilitado a esta mujer luchadora un préstamo con el cual comprará semillas y los insumos necesarios para empezar con este paso de incrementar su negocio y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia, 32, is single and has three children: Richard, 17, Pablo, 13 and Mayte, 9. Despite obstacles and the lack of economic resources they’ve been able to get ahead and Silvia hopes to give her children the education she did not have the opportunity to complete for she was only able to go to elementary school.

Silvia lives with her children in El Pacto, a parish in Quito Canton, located in Pichincha Province in the Republic of Ecuador.  Pacto is located in the northwest of Quito Metropolitan District.  Its history started in the Pre-Inca era and its name comes from pacts reached between important political parties.  As to its economy, it’s an agricultural and animal husbandry zone and due to its climate and geography its crops are from both the coastal and the mountain regions.  Its residents live day to day from these activities and although it’s far from the city there are families that have started all types of activities to cover their and their community’s needs.

Silvia has been growing sugarcane for 13 years.  She works ten-hours per day in this activity caring for, watering and harvesting the crops.  She learned this activity from her mother and then with the experience she acquired.  Silvia is an enterprising woman who is motivated to continue forward by her own devices, for her children and for her family.  She does the work with help from her sister and also with her children’s help.

Silvia hopes to prepare herself to better manage her business and expects to increase her income with higher crop yields and hopes too for supplies to provide adequate care to her existing crops so as to not have any losses.  

Fundación Alternativa has provided this tenacious woman with a loan to buy seeds and the necessary supplies to start this step towards expanding her business and thus improving her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Aramazan

texts.en: Aramazan is a 56-year-old hardworking man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling clothes for 12 years and has been able to pay school fees for his children and to renovate his house with the income from his business. Aramazan's major business challenges are the seasonal nature of the product and his customers' ever-changing tastes and different preferences. His business desire is to own a modern boutique and to diversify by including a retail shop. Aramazan is requesting a loan to buy clothes, sugar, salt and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sugar, salt and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a thirty-year-old ambitious man living in Kasese, Uganda.He has been an accountant for four years, works five days a week and eight hours a day at Uganda Martyrs College. He has a passion for his job and his target is to become a certified charted accountant. 

Lack of adequate time to concentrate on his studies due to work pressure is his major challenge while his dream is to set up a consultancy firm. Charles intends to use the loan to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself

loans.name: Venus - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento VENUS – 32 está  compuesto por diez  integrantes siete mujeres y tres varones la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Abigail tiene 22 años y tiene un hijito de la edad de 2 años, La Sra. Abigail tiene la actividad de venta de accesorios para movilidad desde hace ya bastante tiempo tiene su tienda de accesorios que se encuentra en la zona Siles en este lugar es muy concurrido por choferes que realizan el mantenimiento de sus vehículos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Abigail va a usar este préstamo para la compra de accesorios y repuestos para surtir su tienda   y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Abigail va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando accesorio  la Sra. Abigail  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Venus - 32 is made up of ten members, seven women and three men. The bank president is Abigail. She is 22 years old and has a small son who is 2 years old.

Abigail has had as her activity the sales of car accessories for quite awhile. She has her accessory store in the area of Siles. This place is very popular with drivers who perform maintenance on their vehicles.

This loan is the first sequence with the institution. Abigail is going to use this loan to buy accessories and spare parts to stock her store and thus be able to give her clients better service and increase her profits. Her reason for the loan is to continue improving her business.

Abigail is going to use the profits to continue buying accessories. Abigail is a very hardworking person. She feels happy for the opportunity given to her and her companions in the group since in some cases they maintain their families alone.

loans.use: to buy car accessories and spare parts to supply her store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 40 years old, married, and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a mother of five children. She grows bananas to earn a living and earns a total of 12,000 PHP a month from this work. She has been engaged in this activity for three years already. 
Elvira has requested a loan of 28,500 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She's been a member of GDMPC since 2010. Elvira hopes to reap more from her investment and expand the cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Ms. Zakia is a 41-year-old married woman and a loving mother of five children, four daughters and one son. She is running a business of making clay pots. She offers various pots for water filling and also for home decorations. She has expanded her family business through all of her hard work. Her husband also assists her in selling pots at the local market. Zakia is very creative in making new and attractive pots. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more packets of clay powder, wires and buckets of paints. This will help her to cater to more customers without fail.  She desires to spend part of the profits on the wedding ceremony of her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase more packets of clay powder, wires and buckets of paints.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 21 years old, married. Ali lives with eight family members, of whom three are employed.
Ali is a barber. He established his business in 2009, and now he has two employees. He has acquired good experience in this field. He is well known in the surrounding area for his excellent reputation.
He is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 to buy a new air conditioner and to install a display window and an awning. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new air conditioner and to install a display window and an awning for his barber shop.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en: Vahe lives in Kechut village, in Vayotc Dzor region, with his wife and 2-year-old daughter. He is a policeman and works at the local police station. Vahe is also involved in cattle breeding. He and his wife keep 3 cows and 2 oxen. As cattle breeding helps Vahe to have a stable income throughout the year, he has decided to expand it. Vahe has requested this loan to purchase a calf and forage to feed it. He plans to raise the calf and get milk, which he will use in cheese production. Selling cheese in the local markets will significantly increase Vahe's income and will enable him to provide a better life for his young family.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage to feed it.

location.town: Kechut village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Mesach

texts.en: Mesach, 25, a resident of the Kasubi suburb of Kampala, started a food vending business at the age of 17, when he lost his father, then the only bread winner, five years ago. His mother could not afford to pay for their school fees and their living expenses. This forced Mesach to drop out of school, and he decided to start working to support his aging mother and a brother. He boasts of having been able to use his first Ugafode loan of Ushs. 300,000 to pay his brother’s school fees and, at the same time, to give support to his mother. His current dream is to pay for his brother’s school fees up to a tertiary institution. In the photo is Mesach (left) at his makeshift food stall with Ugafode staff, during a site visit.

loans.use: to buy chickens to roast and sell in his food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nolambay

texts.en:
This is Nolambay. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her retail business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her variety store's inventory. She also has a food stall where she sells different Filipino viands. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nolambay hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma, 47, is married and has ten children. She's from Ozamis City. To make her living, Elma manages and cultivates a cassava production business. Elma has been, for 30 years, engaged in her business and she earns 10,000 PHP a month. 
In 2010, Elma joined GDMPC. She applied for a loan of 16,500 PHP to buy farm fertilizer. Elma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a thirty-one-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a teacher and has been in this service for eight years. His love to inspire the young generation drove him into the profession despite the low pay he earns as salary from government. 

He wishes to venture into commercial farming to supplement his salary and also educate his children up to the University level. Nelson is requesting for a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda works hard to support 7 children. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Nilda requested an 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Nilda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Mr. Gantulga is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. His wife, Dulamsuren, stays home and takes care of their daughters, Maralgoo and Gandulam, ages 4 and 2 years. 

Gantulga has been working at a butcher place for more than four years. He has obtained a lot of experience in the butcher and meat retail business. He and his wife are planning to start up a business, retailing meat in the local market. Dulamsuren will be working as the salesperson, and Gantulga will be supplying meat for cheaper wholesale prices, from the butcher place where he works. 

Now Gantulga is requesting 1,100,000 MNT to purchase two big cattle, with which they will start their business of retailing meat in the local market. Gantulga and his wife are diligent, responsible people.

loans.use: to purchase two big cattle to use in starting their new business, selling meat in a local market.

loans.name: Cerelino

texts.en:
Cerelino is a 47-year-old farmer from Ubay, Bohol. He has been in the rice farming business for several years.

Cerelino is asking for a loan to buy to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With this loan, he will able to improve his farm.

In the future, Cerelino hopes of making his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for future use.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina, de 26 años es una mujer trabajadora, vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos en la casa de ellos, desde que nació. Desde hace 5 años fábrica bebidas refrescantes, poco a poco ha crecido por el esfuerzo y  muchas horas de trabajo que sacrifica cada día. Su trabajo consiste en elaborar por ella misma bebidas gasificadas, como también jugos de diversas frutas, las que después envasa y empaqueta en bolsas. Su trabajo es constante, ella es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas aspiraciones por lo que desea desarrollar sus conocimientos de ingeniería industrial y crecer en su negocio. Por el momento su producción es vendida a distintas ciudades del país, muchas veces las dificultades se presentan en época de lluvias, es por eso que siempre toma las medidas de precaución, su madre la ayuda en la fabricación, “es mi mano derecha”, menciona. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo recibido ya que durante todo este tiempo pudo dinamizar sus ingresos y mantener a su negocio en buenas condiciones financieras. Es así que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Karina, invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumos necesarios como: azúcar, saborizantes, colorantes y frutas para la elaboración de jugos. Además de envases reciclables en grandes cantidades para envasar.
texts.en:
Karina, 26, is a hardworking woman living since birth with her parents and siblings in their house.  She’s been manufacturing refreshing beverages for five years.  She’s gradually grown thanks to her efforts and the many hours of daily sacrifice.  Her work consists in making carbonated beverages herself as well as various fruit juices which she then bottles and packages in bags.  Her work is constant.  She’s a very hardworking, ambitious woman who wants to develop her knowledge of industrial engineering and to make her business grow.  For the moment, her production is sold in various cities in the country and she often has difficulty during the rainy season which is why she always takes preventive measures.  Her mother helps her with production; “She’s my right hand,” she mentions.  

This is the fifth MFP loan and she’s grateful for the support she’s gotten because in all this time she’s been able to speed up her income and maintain her business in good financial condition so she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.

Karina will invest the money in the purchase of necessary ingredients like sugar, flavoring agents, coloring agents and fruit to make the juices.  She will also buy large amounts of recyclable bottling packaging.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flavoring agents, coloring agents and fruit as well as recyclable packaging.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea, de 67 años es una mujer alegre y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Marcelino, con quien vive en la actualidad en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo construyeron.  Desde muy temprano, a primeras horas del día; se levanta para seguir con los cuidados y alimentación de sus animales, posee, vacas, toros y ovejas que diariamente cuida con mucho esmero. Su trabajo consiste en engordarlas y revenderlas a un mayor precio, “en esta temporada de navidad, las personas consumen mucha carne, por lo que tengo mucha venta”, afirma. Andrea y su esposo también siembran, pues son buenos agriculturas e hijos del campo, desean poder seguir con la crianza de sus animales y así continuar obteniendo las ganancias, pues todavía tienen fuerzas para seguir. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo recibido ya que durante todo este tiempo pudo dinamizar sus ingresos y mantener a su negocio en buenas condiciones financieras. Es así que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Andrea, invertirá el dinero en la compra de una vaca para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en: Andrea, 67, is a cheerful, hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband, Marcelino, in a house they built with much effort.  From the very first hours of the day she rises to start caring for and feeding her animals.  She owns cows, bulls and sheep she cares for diligently every day.  Her work consists in fattening them up and reselling them for a higher price.  “During the Christmas season, people consume much meat so I sell a lot,” she affirms.  Andrea and her husband also plant because like all good farmers and children of the countryside, they want to continue raising their animals to continue earning profits since they still have the strength to go on.  This is her 7th MFP loan and she’s grateful for the support provided all this time because she was able to speed up her income and maintain the business in good financial condition so she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  Andrea will use the money to buy a cow to increase her herd size.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Violetas-31 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento VIOLETAS-31 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones el presidente del banco es el Sr. René tiene 66 años y tiene un hijo de la edad de 16 años, El Sr. René se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace ya bastante tiempo como el dice toda mi vida soy chofer, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. René  utilizara este préstamo para la reparación de su vehículo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que su vehículo está presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite desarrollar de una manera eficiente su trabajo,  este vehículo es su único medio de trabajo y con los ingresos que genera mantiene a su familia el Sr. Rene se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The communal bank Violetas - 31 is made up of eight members, six women and two men.

The president of the bank is René. He is 66 years old and has a son who is 16 years old. René has been working in passenger transport for quite some time and he says that, “I've been a driver all my life.” 

This loan is his first sequence with the institution. René will use this loan to repair his vehicle. His reason for asking for this loan is that his vehicle needs repair and he is unable to efficiently carry on his work. This vehicle is his only means of working and the income that it generates supports his family. 

René feels happy and grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to pay for repairs of his vehicle that he uses in his passenger transport service

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 60 years old and married with two children.

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as canned goods, spices, eggs, noodles, etc.

Emelia has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from the sale of charcoal.

Emelia aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as canned goods, spices, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet's Group is comprised of six hard working women. Annet is 22 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is marreid and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Annet has been working hard to manage her small business, through which she sells dry food. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more foods such as dry beans and maize to be sold, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more foods, such as dry beans and maize, to be sold

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, de 32 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa e hijos en la casa que heredó hace algunos años. Él es un hombre trabajador y cumplido, todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se dirige a los campos a cuidar de sus animales posee: caballos, vacas, toros y demás animales menores. Su trabajo consiste en engordar a los animales para poder vender a buen precio entre los carniceros o demás ganaderos de la región. Gracias a su trabajo puede mantener a su familia y brindarles educación a sus hijos, su esfuerzo es recompensado pues menciona, que viaja mucho sobre todo a la ciudad de La Oroya, donde obtiene clientes fijos que comercializan sus animales. Ahora espera obtener una buena crianza para así ofrecer a buen precio a sus animales. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo recibido ya que durante todo este tiempo pudo dinamizar sus ingresos y mantener a su negocio en buenas condiciones financieras. Es así que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Jesús invertirá el dinero en la compra de más animales para engordarlos y así proseguir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jesús, who is 32 years old, is a hardworking man. He lives with his wife and children in a house that he inherited a few years ago. He is hardworking and responsible. He gets up early every morning and goes out to the fields to look after his animals: horses, cows, bulls and other smaller animals. 

His work consists of fattening animals to sell for a good price to local butchers or other famers in the area. Thanks to this work he can support his family and provide his children with an education. His efforts are rewarded as, he says, he gets to travel a lot especially to the city of La Oroya, where he has regular customers who sell his animals. He hopes that the animals he is rearing now will be good quality and therefore that he will get a good price for them. 

This will be his second loan with MFP. He is grateful for the support he has received as it has enabled him to improve his income and to maintain his business’ healthy financial position. This allows him to commit to making his payments on time.

Jesús will invest the money in the purchase of more animals for fattening, and thus carry on his business.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emilda works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Emilda is borrowing PHP 26000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Emilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena de 46 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, venta de comida y refacciones en un  pequeño local en su domicilio tendiendo así  muy buenas ventas   ya que su local se ubica a las cercanías del mercado Central del Municipio de San Juan Sacatepequez, doña Elena  necesita capital para estas fechas ya que por años en la temporada  navideña ella logra realizar la venta de ropa típica ofreciendo prendas como suéteres, blusas, fajas, rebosos, los que tienen mucha demanda  como también incluye  juguetes y frutas como  las uvas y manzanas es por ello que necesita  invertir y aprovechar  las ventas  navideñas , y siempre ocuparse de su negocio de diario de  venta de tortillas y comida.Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz, y mercaderia de temporada como uvas manzanas.
texts.en:
María Elena, 46, makes a living selling tortillas, food, and snacks in a small place in her home, where she has good sales because she's located near the central town market in San Juan Sacatepequez.  Elena needs capital these days because for years she has sold traditional clothing during the Christmas season, offering garments that are in great demand such as sweaters, blouses, skirts, and shawls.  She also includes toys and fruits such as grapes and apples.

This is why she needs to invest and make the most of Christmas sales, and always look after her daily business selling tortillas and food.

She's requesting this loan to buy corn and seasonal merchandise such as grapes and apples.

loans.use: to buy corn and seasonal merchandise such as grapes and apples

loans.name: Myagmar-Od

texts.en: Mr. Myagmar-Od is 26 years old and lives with his wife and son in her sister's house in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. His wife, Bulganchimeg, is 26 years old and works as a salesperson in a private company. His son, Telmuun, is 2 years old and goes to kindergarten. The borrower started his business of clothing retail at a local shopping center 4 years ago. He has built a close relationship with his customers and is well-known within the area. He needs an additional investment of 3,100,000 MNT to purchase seasonal clothes to sell during New Year's and Lunar New Year's to increase his income and improve his life. He is a hardworking, optimistic and diligent person.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothes to sell during New Year's and Lunar New Year's to increase his income and improve his life

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en: Anitha is 41 years old. She wants to engage in the business of mineral resources, such as coltan. With the loan, she wants to invest in the mining industry. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more mineral resources for sale.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 24 years old. He is unmarried and has no dependents. He is a private teacher for primary school children. His business is in Eldama Ravine. He has been in this business for the last two years.


Abraham has borrowed a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase teaching materials and other items for his business. With the income from the business, he intends to expand his business. He hopes to open a private school in the future.

loans.use: To purchase teaching materials

loans.name: Pia Mahal

texts.en:
Pia Mahal is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Pia Mahal has been in this business for 20 years. Pia Mahal earns additional income from a ready-to-wear business.

Pia Mahal has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 34 years old. She sells beans and sorghum and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she wants to add more beans and sorghum for resale. She plans to use the profits for making savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is a 35-year-old, married man, who has three children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is a teacher and has been in service for 12 years. To supplement his meager salary he bought a motorcycle, which he rents to a rider. The rider pays 70% of the amount earned each day by using the motorcycle, to Sunday, as rent. 

Sunday dreams of educating his children up to the University, and of venturing into modern farming since Uganda depends upon agriculture for its economy. Sunday is requesting a loan to buy land, for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Shimshad

texts.en:
Mrs Shimshad is 35 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of two children. She has had a hand-embroidery business for the past 15 years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is working as a laborer, but his income is not enough to support his family well. Shimshad's embroidery designs are very popular in her community, and she is the highest-earning resource in her household. 

Shimshad wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy raw materials, such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls, in many different colors, to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls in her village. She would teach them embroidery skills, so they could help her expand her business, and could earn money for themselves, as well.  She aspires to save money for building a new house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls, in many colors, to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Rahiema

texts.en:
This is Rahiema, 32, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. Single, she lives with her parents and helps them to manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to help her parents with their everyday expenses.

Rahiema operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP amoun of cooking oil, or an egg. She also sells fish of different kinds and meat. She earns money by obtaining supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rahiema wants to be a successful entrepreneur. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 26 years old and married, and she supports a family of three. She runs a clothing sales business, and this has been her income-generating business for the last four years. She earns an average monthly income of KES 20,000 from it. 

She has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000, after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She intends to use this current loan to purchase more clothing for resale. 

She anticipates getting profits, which she will use to expand her business by buying even more items to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Oyundelger

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyundelger is a 48-year-old widow who lives with her three children in a ger in Sainshand Soum in Dornigobi province of Mongolia. Her sons Oyunbaatar and Enhbat, ages 24 and 21, work at a construction site as assistant workers, and her daughter Oyun-Erdene, age 27, helps her mother to run her organic vegetable sales business at the local market.

Oyundelger, who had been working as a saleswoman in the local market since 2008, started her own organic vegetable retail business at that market in February of 2012, having received a new business loan that she has since repaid. She is now requesting a loan of 3'000'000MNT to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables to sell during winter and spring. A hardworking and responsible woman, Oyundelger says, "XacBank loans help me a lot, and I really appreciate that they granted me a loan."

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables to sell during winter and spring.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline, a 24-year-old mother of three children, two of whom attend school, has been in the business of selling clothes for the past four years. With this loan, she wants to buy more bed sheets and clothes for sale. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Viviana es la tesorera de Banco Mujer Mujeres Triunfadoras,  con  26 años de edad, es casada y es madre de 2 hijos, una niña de 9 años, y un niño de 2 años. La actividad que desarrolla es la cría de pollos, y el crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de estos animales así como los alimentos, concentrados y vitaminas necesarias para la cría y engorde, gracias al préstamo aumentó  su producción. Para este su segundo crédito va a incursionar también en la cría de cerdos, y el plan de inversión es la compra de los animales y sus alimentos, y así complementar las 2 actividades, siempre buscando como generar ingresos para ayudar a solventar los gastos familiares. 
El crédito ha sido de gran ayuda ya que Viviana pudo empezar las mejoras a su vivienda como se lo había propuesto, y así poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. 
El resto de las integrantes de este banco van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Viviana is the treasurer of the Banco Mujer Mujeres Triunfadoras. She is 26 years old, married and is the mother of 2 children, one 9 year old daughter, and a 2 year old son.

She raises chickens. Her previous loan was invested in the purchase of these animals and concentrated feed and vitamins needed for the growth and fattening. Thanks to the loan she increased her production. 

For this second loan she is going to explore raising pigs, and she plans to invest in the purchase of these animals and their feed, and thus to supplement the two activities, always looking to generate income to help pay the household expenses.

The credit has been a great help because Viviana could begin improvements to her housing as she had proposed, and was able to give a better quality of life to her children.

The remaining members of this bank will invest in agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed, vitamins, and other items

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro  es un hombre agricultor de 67  años de edad.  El está casado  y  vive en Sololá.  El tiene cinco  hijos de ellos cuatro mujeres que están casadas y un varón que  lo apoya en el campo de la agricultura.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla y papa  en parcelas que tiene  a pocos metros de su casa, esto lo aprendió de su padre desde que era pequeño porque el lo ayudaba en el campo de la agricultura siendo su principal trabajo en la actualidad.
El empezó a trabajar su propio cultivo desde los 15 años, vio que ya tenía la capacidad y la posibilidad  de trabajar solo por que obtiene ganancias buenas cultivando estas verduras.   De este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q  3,200.00 para que el pueda comprar semillas de papa y su fertilizante para cultivar  y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
El sueña con expandir su cultivo en otras parcelas para generar mejores ganancias para la familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is farmer who is 67 years old. He is married and lives in Sololá. He has five children and four of them are married and he has a son who helps him in the fields.

He works growing onions and potatoes on plots that are a few meters from his home. He learned from his father from a very early age because he helped him in the fields and this is his main work today.

He began to work his own crops at the age of 15. He saw that he had the ability and possibility of working alone to get good profits growing these vegetables. This is why he is asking for 3,200 quetzales so he can buy potato seeds and fertilizer for cultivation and harvesting, improving the family income.

His dream is to expand his cultivation to other plots to generate better earnings for his family.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate his crops

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single mother of five children and only two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 800000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works from her home seven days a week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and transportation of bags of charcoal from the market to her home. She is aspiring to see her business grow big so that she starts going to villages for charcoal. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a 40-year-old, married woman, and a mother of four young children, from Ubay, Bohol. She earns a living by fish vending. Her husband also works as a fish vendor.

Chona is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell, to the people in her neighborhood.

Chona hopes to expand her business in the future, to augment her income so that she can support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Giovanny Enrique

texts.es: El joven Giovanny labora como oficial planificador para el estado y también estudia la carrera de ingeniería en sistemas con el apoyo económico de sus padres, su mayor deseo es terminar su profesión para optar por un mejor puesto en su centro de trabajo, ya que existe la posibilidad de un asenso de grado, por eso Giovanny solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera, su salario es muy bajo para poder cubrir este costo tan alto de un solo pago, agradece el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Young Giovanny works for the state as an official planner and also he is studying for a degree in systems engineering with financial support from his parents.

His biggest dream is to finish his degree in order to gain a better position in the workplace, since the possibility exists of a grade increase.

This is why Giovanny is asking for a loan so he can pay for the diploma fees. Her salary is too low to cover the cost so high for a single payment. He is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to pay diploma fees for his systems engineering course so he can gain a better position in the workplace.

loans.name: Console

texts.en: Console is married and has two children. She sells goats and has been in the business of selling animals for more than five years. She wants the loan in order to add more goats for sale. With the profits from the business she will pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Buscando El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Kimberly  es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Buscando El Triunfo, tiene 27 años, y vive con su esposo, tiene poco tiempo de casada y por el  momento no quiere tener hijos, ya que quiere terminar sus estudios,  tener un negocio propio en el centro de su comunidad, y llegar a tener estabilidad económica para así poder darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 
Los 2 créditos anteriores han sido de gran ayuda, le han permitido hacer crecer su negocio, continuar con sus estudios, y contribuir a los gastos del hogar, ya que su esposo tiene un salario muy bajo. 
Sus 2 compañeras de grupo van a invertir en actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
Kimberly is one of the members of the Banco Mujer Buscando El Triunfo. She is 27 years old. She lives with her husband. She has been married a short time and at the moment does not want to have children as she wants to finish her studies, to have her own business in the center of their community, and to have economic stability in order to be able to offer children a better quality of life.

Her last two loans have been a big help, permitting her to grow her business, to continue her studies, and to contribute to the household expenses, since her husband has a very low salary.

Her two companions in the group are going to invest in business activities.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shoes for her business

loans.name: Ma.charie

texts.en: Ma. Charie is a 25 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two kids: a seven year old boy and a five year old girl. Her husband is a fisherman. She has been running a sari sari (variety) store for 6 years now, and earns 15,000 PHP per month. Ma. Charie is requesting a loan to put additional capital in her business so she can buy more items to sell in her store like toiletries, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, snacks, etc. In the future, Ma. Charie hopes to expand her business. With her income, she will be able to meet the daily needs of her family and especially assist her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
This is Merly. She previously received a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and with their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 16,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She also engages in direct selling business for additional income. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and is thankful in her heart. 

Merly dreams that her children will be able to finish all their studies. She wants them to enjoy a good life. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. The Word of God strengthens her spiritual life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.en:
Ciriaco is a farmer from Ubay, Bohol. He has been in the rice farming business for several years. Ciriaco wants to avail himself of a loan, to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With these things, he will be able to improve his farm and his harvest.

Ciriaco dreams of making his business a success, so that it will continue to generate more revenue, which is necessary for supporting the family, and especially for the future schooling of his two young children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn, 33, is married and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. All of her children are in school.

Ailyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. Ailyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF, to buy additional boxes of fish to resell.

Ailyn would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to resell

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is a 53-year-old married woman with children from Talibon, Bohol. She owns a sari-sari store and at the same time has been selling food and vegetables for many years. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a tricycle driver.

Veneranda is asking for a loan to buy fish, vegetables, and other items for her sari-sari store. Through this loan, she will be able to buy more fish to sell and at the same time there will be enough items like toiletries, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, milk, coffee, etc. in her store so that she can attract more customers.

In the future, Veneranda dreams to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish, vegetables, and other items for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Togtohnamsrai

texts.en:
Togtohnamsrai is 61 years old and lives alone in a ger in the Chingeltai district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son lives on her plot of land in a separate ger with his wife and child. She and her son Bold, age 34, have worked together since 2001 in a local market selling wooden products. Togtohnamsrai and her son started their business of wooden furniture manufacturing recently and they already built a strong customer base within the area and they produce wooden furniture from customer orders. They have obtained a lot of experience and the business is the main source of income for both her and her son's family.  

Togtohnamsrai is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase additional inventory to meet customer orders on time in order to increase business income and profit. She and her son are both hardworking and diligent people. She has been a client of Xacbank for about 5 years now and she has been a good client with no delinquent payments.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to meet customers' orders on time in order to increase business income and profit

loans.name: Petronia

texts.en:
Petronia is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Petronia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like spices, canned goods, soap, etc.

Petronia has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future, Petronia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell like spices, canned goods, soap, etc.

loans.name: Josefena

texts.en:
Josefena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Josefena has been in this business for 20 years.

Josefena requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to resell.

Josefena would like to save enough money so that, in the future, she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora de 40 años convive con Víctor con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, de 18, 14 y 9 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa propia ubicada en un distrito de la selva central.

Aurora se dedica a las labores del campo, con su carácter perseverante y empeñoso. Desde pequeña aprendió esta actividad y es así como mantiene a su familia. 
Ella siembra piñas, plátanos y café en la localidad de La Esperanza (a 2 horas de su vivienda), por eso se dirige con frecuencia para atender sus cultivos. En tiempos de cosecha de piñas obtiene en una semana 100 cajones de piñas, los que vende a 7 soles cada uno. “En febrero el precio nos favorece por que llega a costar a 11 soles el cajón”, menciona, por ello éste mes se esmera en sus cuidados. Mientras tanto va cosechando naranjas, las que vende en la ciudad más cercana. 
Aunque el precio de los cítricos, éste mes no sea favorable, continuará con sus labores agrícolas, porque es lo que le gusta hacer. Éste sería su préstamo número 9 con  MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Heliconias” y tiene confianza en el trabajo en equipo para lograr sus objetivos.
Invertirá los 500 soles en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos de cítricos, piñas y café.
texts.en:
Aurora, 40, lives with Víctor, with whom she has four children, but she only lives with three of them, ages 18, 14, and 9.  This family lives in their own house located in the central jungle district.

Aurora makes a living working in the fields, with her persevering and hardworking character.  She learned this work when she was little and this is how she supports her family.

She grows pineapples, bananas, and coffee in the town of La Esperanza (two hours from her home), where she goes frequently to look after her crops.  During the pineapple harvest, in a week she gets 100 crates of pineapples, which she sells for 7 soles [PEN] each.  "In February the price is favorable for us because it reaches 11 soles a crate," she says.  That's why this month she works hard on her tasks.  Meanwhile she's harvesting oranges, which she sells in the closer city.  Although the price of citrus isn't favorable this month, she'll continue with her farm labor because it's what she likes to do.

This would be her ninth loan with MFP, so she's committed to making her payments on time.  She belongs to Las Heliconias Communal Bank and she's confident about the teamwork for achieving her objectives.

She'll use the 500 soles to hire day laborer to weed her citrus, pineapple, and coffee crops.

loans.use: to hire day laborers

loans.name: Sharon's Group

texts.en:
"Sharon's Group" is comprised of 4 hard working women. Sharon is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Sharon has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Sharon has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more vegetables such as tomatoes, and will help Sharon to generate greater profits and pay for her medical bills. Sharon hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Sharon is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables such as tomatoes

loans.name: Sardan

texts.en:
Sardan is 63 years old, married, and has five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Sardan has a food vending business in the Philippines. Sardan requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her business.

Sardan has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Sardan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her food vending business

loans.name: Faida

texts.en: Faida is a 32 year old businessman who lives in Yei. He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 10. All of them go to school. Faida runs a clothing store, and has been in business for 3 years. He has no employees, and no other source of income. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions done by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase more clothes to sell. In 5 years Faida would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. He says he is happy about the loans he has received through Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 59 years old, married, and has 5 children. She is from Tabuan, Tukuran and has been farming for 12 years, earning an amount of 20,000 PHP a month. Recently, Margarita joined GDMPC. Margarita is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure for her farming. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for her farming.

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en: Ediltrudes is a 44 year old coconut shell dealer from Panglao, Bohol. Coconut shells are valued as firewood and are used in making charcoal. Ediltrudes is asking for a loan to buy more coconut shells to sell to her customers.  In the future, Ediltrudes dreams of becoming a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells to sell

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en: Zarrina is one of the smart members of her family. She is 42 years old. She is married to a kind man who is a master of repairing houses. Zarrina is a mother of 2 children. Zarrina and her husband try to provide them with high-quality living conditions. With this aim, she began her own business 6 years ago to sell kuraga. She buys apricots from the local market, processes the apricots, and sells them as kuraga. She tries to communicate with customers in a kind manner and to serve them a high-quality product. In this way, she attracts more customers than some other businesses. Zarrina, as a reasonable woman, uses her income to provide for her family. She repaired her house with the profits. Now, she wants to develop her business further and with this aim, she is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy the ingredients for making kuraga. Each month she will make her payments on time. She will be happy if you support her. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients for making kuraga

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 37-year-old married woman and has three children ages fourteen, ten, and eight years old. She has been involved in a buy and sell business for 10 years now. This is the source of her income that allows her to provide for her family's daily needs.

Vilma is requesting for a loan to buy a basin, a stock pot, a kettle, a bolo knife, and a saw tool. With the use of the loan, she can buy and sell the mentioned items to increase her profits. The people in her community will not need to go to a store to buy these items and will just go directly to her.

In the future, Vilma dreams of expanding her business. She also wants to have a small piggery.

loans.use: to buy a basin, a stock pot, a kettle, a bolo knife, and a saw tool to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 46 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Cecilia has been raising pigs for 10 years, and also earns additional income from fish-vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en: Mr. Sergelen is 45 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a Ger in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. His wife, Adiyasuren, is 42 years old and has just given birth to their youngest son. She stays home taking care of the newborn baby. He has two other sons: Batsaihan is 23 years old and is a herder outside of the province centre, and Bat-Erdene is 20 years old and works as a salesperson in a shopping center. His daughter, Ichinhorloo, is 16 years old and is a senior at a local secondary school. He has been operating a construction and renovation business with his wife since 1995. They have covered both their sons' university tuition and living expenses since then and now they are trying to save for their daughter to go to university next year. Family expenses have also increased since the baby was born. The borrower is requesting a loan of 600'000 MNT to purchase additional construction materials to run his business smoothly without temporary pauses in business. He and his wife are hardworking, honest and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction materials to run his business smoothly and without temporary pauses in business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 18 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her small business of selling cassava flour. 

To help expand her business, Juliet  has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cassava flour for resell, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and pay for her medical bills. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Juliet  is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to resell

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 32 years.

Felomina requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Felomina would like to save enough money so that, in the future, she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase a greater variety, and larger quantities, of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her family's other expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new loan of 17,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her store's inventory. In addition to the general store, she earns income from a computer shop that she owns. Her profits from business will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and pay for her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase from using her loan, with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Editha simply aspires to have a happy family. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages, to resell in her store.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
This is Felina, 50, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Christopher, a security guard, and a mother. Felina  and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.  

Felina operates a school/office supply business. It is where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, posterboards, etc., without going to a bookstore. She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. She uses a pedicab to sell her products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to expand her school supply product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Felina wants her business to prosper through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for office and school supplies needed for her business

loans.name: Lumturije

texts.en:
Lumturije an Egyptian lady who is devoted to Christianity is in her fifties and lives in south eastern Albania. She is married and has only a grown up son and grandchildren. They all live in the same house and Lumturije adores her grandchildren. Unlike other members of her community who live in suburbia she plants veggies and crops and this earns her an income. In addition to this, she also buys and sells new items, from clothes to children's toys and has been doing this for almost ten years.

Lumturije now is requesting a loan from VisionFund Albania.  This loan is not her first, and previous ones have been paid off.  With this loan, she wants to buy items to resell.

Lumturije’s dream is to save some money to educate her granddaughters which she has been photographed with here.

loans.use: To buy new inventory items to resell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, from St. Niño, helps her family through a fishing business. She’s 46 years old and married, and she has three children. She tries her best to earn money on her own. She has managed the fishing business for four years, and she earns about 4,500 PHP per month. 

Now she needs to purchase new fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. She thanks GDMPC micro finance for the loan of 11,000 PHP they provided to her. Judith desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Belarmina

texts.en:
Belarmina is a married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has been running a sari sari, or variety store business, for several years, selling various goods and commodities to the people in her locality.

Belarmina is asking for a loan to buy more stock, such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, etc. to resell. 

Belarmina dreams of making her business a success. Her income will be for her family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Alika

texts.en:
Alika is 29 years old, a single man who lives with his mother and brother in the Telavi district. The family does not have a source of income at the moment, as all the family members are unemployed. 

Alika has recently returned from the Ukraine, where he worked as a cook. Now, he plans to start up a café. The local credit providers have rejected his loan request because of low income. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. 

The start-up loan program envisages the provisions of business start-ups and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the increased credit, Alika will purchase a cash desk, kitchen appliances and stocks of products that will be used for cooking meals. According to Alika’s estimations, his project will be profitable, and he will attract many customers.  As a result of the new business initiative, the income of the family will increase and their living conditions will improve.  In addition to the above mentioned, in case of need in the future, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase a cash desk, kitchen appliances and stocks of products for starting a cafe.

loans.name: Asiina's Group

texts.en:
Asiina's group is comprised of two hard working women. Asiina is 21 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past four years, Asiina has been working hard to manage her small business of selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Asiina has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Asiina to generate greater profits and take care of her self. Asiina hopes that in the future she will be able to build herself a house. 

Asiina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in the business for 15 years. 

Erlinda requested a 15000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fruit to sell. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to support her fruit-vending business by buying additional fruit.

loans.name: Dema

texts.en:
This is Dema, 51, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Benjamin, a carpenter. Dema and her husband manage their household while operating the business. Dema works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Dema operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Dema also sells fish and different kinds and meat.  She earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Dema earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Dema is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Dema wants to give a good life to her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new inventory items to resell in the local market.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a 43-year-old married woman with four young children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been involved in a buy and sell business for 8 years now. Her monthly earnings with this business is 15,000 PHP. This is the source of her income.

Erna is requesting for a loan to buy garlic, chlorine, pepper, tawas, and alum. These products will be repackaged into smaller amounts for sale.

In the future, Vilma dreams of expanding her business so that she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy garlic, chlorine, pepper, tawas, and alum

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en: Donathile is 44 years old. She owns a store where she sells different items. With this loan she wants to add more rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soaps to her store. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Topista's Group

texts.en:
Topista's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Topista is 18 years old, and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Topista has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells dry cassava flour.
