Francisco is 43 years old, and lives with his wife and their six children in a village which is part of the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. He has farmed his whole life, and has approximately 35 years of working with his own crops. He grows coffee, corn and beans, and sells his output in the local market. 

He wants his land and crops to have better technical assistance so that he can have better harvests and obtain better profits, as he has future plans to buy two more manzanas (Central American unit of land measurement) of land already cultivated with coffee.

He has applied for a group loan in order to buy fertilizers and pay for labor, so that he can provide good maintenance to his coffee, corn, and bean crops.

The group is called "La Caroza" and is made up of 12 members who in the photo are identified as follows: on the left, standing, is Francisco, the coordinator; next to him is Luis, Yessica, Victoria, José and Santos. On the left, crouching, is Constantino, Neptali, Santos, Zoila, Simeón and José Antonio on the right. They all live in the same community and work in agriculture.

The total group loan is for 73,000 lempiras, and they will invest it in maintaining their crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for labor for growing coffee, corn and beans.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 28 years old and single. He owns a hardware store, which he has been doing for one year. Jean is requesting a loan, which he will use to add more construction materials in his store. He will save the profits to build a better future for his business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to sell.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán, es casado y tiene un hijo que está en etapa escolar en un colegio estatal, viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Tunari  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El estudió hasta el nivel de Técnico Medio y actualmente desempeña las funciones de Oficial de Policía en la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento y fierro. Así podrá hacer el vaciado del piso de su vivienda, que aún es de tierra, para su familia y brindarles mayor comodidad.

El sueño de Hernan es tener una vivienda confortable para su familia.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Hernán’s married and has a school-age son attending public school; they live in their own house located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Tunari zone.  He completed mid-technical education level and works as a police officer for the city of El Alto.  He needs the loan to buy building materials like cement and iron to lay a floor in his house which is still dirt to provide his family with more comfort.  Hernán’s dream is to have a comfortable house for his family.  This is the first time he’s asked IMPRO and KIVA for a loan.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo, de 42 años es un hombre honesto y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Ceferina y sus 6 hijos; a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 12 años. Hace 12 años, Rodolfo implementó su granja de cuyes en un espacio exclusivo de su casa, ahí cuida de sus 500 ejemplares, los cuales atiende con mucho profesionalismo. Ya que los separa de acuerdo a rasgos genético, evitando que exista cruce familiar, de esa manera obtiene buenos ejemplares para la venta.”Tengo compradores fijos para mis cuyes, pues es un alimento rico en vitaminas, además se vende mucho el cuy negro en el mercado, por la creencia que sana algunos males”, comenta. Ahora espera poder aumentar más su producción, ya que tiene mucho campo para poder criar, además de tener muchos compradores y no se puede abastecer. Es por esa razón que espera tener éxito en su nuevo reto. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias, además el préstamo será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Rodolfo, invertirá el dinero en la compra de mallas, palos y demás accesorios para construir las jaulas de los cuyes y si el dinero le alcanza podrá también comprar cuyes de color negro.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 42 years old, and is an honest, hard-working man. He lives with his wife, Ceferina, and their six children, who they raise in a house that Rodolfo bought twelve years ago. 

Twelve years ago, Rodolfo set up his guinea pig farm in an area of his home. He raises 500 guinea pigs there, which he looks after very professionally. He separates them according to their genetic traits, thereby avoiding inbreeding. As a result he gets good animals to sell. 

"I have regular customers for my guinea pigs, because they are a vitamin-rich foodstuff. Black guinea pigs also sell well in the market, because people believe that they cure certain ills." he says. 

He now hopes to increase production, as he has lots of land on which to farm as well as many customers, and he can't meet the demand. That is why he hopes to be successful in his new challenge. 

This is his third loan with MFP. He is very happy to know he has financial support, and he likes being part of his community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive. What's more, the loan will be very useful in the progression of his economic activity. Rodolfo will use the money to buy wire mesh, poles and other materials to build guinea pig cages, and if any money is left over, he will also be able to buy black guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy wire mesh, poles and other materials to build guinea pig cages.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  He owns a welding workshop, which he has been doing for five years.  His monthly income is 25,000 KES. His spouse runs a shop, which helps in producing additional income.

Michael is requesting his second loan for 40,000 KES, which he will use to purchase more stock of welding materials. He plans to use the additional income to invest in his business and to educate his children

loans.use: to purchase welding materials.

loans.name: Yamil

texts.es:
Yamil, es casado y tiene un hijo que está en etapa escolar en un colegio estatal, viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Arasaya kentuyo en la localidad de Achacachi.

El estudio hasta el nivel de Técnico Medio y actualmente desempeña las funciones de Profesor de Música en una Escuela Privada Adventista en la localidad de Achacachi.

El crédito lo requiere para pagar un Curso de Especialización en el Área de Música. Así podrá mejorar sus ingresos para su familia y brindarles mayor comodidad.

El sueño de Yamil es ser un Profesor de música Especializado.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Yamil’s married and has a school-age son attending public school; they live in his parents’ house that’s located in the Arasaya Kentuyo zone in Achacachi.  He completed mid-technical level of education and works as a music teacher at a private Adventist school in Achacachi.  He needs the loan to pay for a music specialization course in order to improve his family income and provide more comfort for them.  Yamil’s dream is to become a specialized music teacher.  This is his first loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for a music course.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, así como amable y con muchas ganas de progresar, esta casada con Cesar quien  trabaja en el ministerio publico. Vive en compañía de su pareja, sus dos hijos de 24 y 18 años de edad. Habitando cómodamente en una casa alquilada. La actividad que realiza Maritza es la venta de comidas rápidas en las noches, como pollos broster y alitas fritas, entre otros, instalándose en el frontis de una bodega cerca de la casa de su madre, dedicándose a este negocio cerca de 1 años, contando con la ayuda de su hermana. Además también se dedica a la venta de ropas de damas y caballeros que le envía de su tía desde la ciudad de Lima cada 02 meses para luego venderlo de manera ambulatorio junto a su hijo mayor  entre sus amistades y clientes de su venta de comidas.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener una ocupación ya que no pudo concluir sus estudios superiores y por la necesidad de tener un oficio y un ingreso económico con el cual apoyar a su pareja en los gastos de su hogar ya que sus hijos tenias gastos en lo estudios y tenían más necesidades, ahora viendo los buenos resultados por los ganancias que le genera, tiene planes de abrir una boutique o un restaurante. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de damas y caballeros a precio por mayor para venderlo entre sus amistades pensando en ésta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Maritza, 46, is a hardworking, cheerful woman in addition to being kind with a strong wish to make progress.  She’s married to Cesar who works for the public defender’s office.  She lives comfortably in a rented house with her spouse and two children who are 24 and 18 years of age.

Maritza’s work is selling fast-food like Broasted chicken and fried chicken wings, among others at night.  She sets up in front of a store near her mother’s house.  She’s been in business for about a year and her sister helps her.  She also works selling women’s and men’s clothes that her aunt sends her from Lima every two months to then sell from place to place with her oldest so among her acquaintances and her fast-food customers.

What she enjoys about her work is that it allows her to have an occupation since she was unable to complete higher education and needed to have a job and income to help her husband with household expenses since her children had schooling costs and more needs.  Now, seeing the good results she gets from generated profits, she plans to open a boutique or a restaurant.  She will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy women’s and men’s clothes at wholesale prices to resell to her acquaintances in light of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothes.

loans.name: Arzigul

texts.ru: Арзигул жительница района Дж. Руми. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Арзигул домохозяйка. Муж Арзигул занимается животноводством и земледелием. Ее дочь имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности она портниха. Арзигул берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки для свой дочери, чтобы она начала свою деятельность и стала самостоятельной. Так как дочь Арзигул не такой сильно уверенный в себе человек, Арзигул хочет помочь ей. Она надеется, что вы ей поможете в этом.
texts.en:
Arzigul is a resident of the J. Rumy region.  She is 45 years old, married and has three children. Arzigul is a homemaker. Arzigul's husband is engaged in raising animals and agriculture. Her daughter has a high school education. By speciality, she is a seamstress. 

Arzigul is taking a loan for the purchase of a sewing machine for her daughter, so she can start her own business and become independent. Since her daughter is not such a confident person, Arzigul wants to help her.  She hopes that you will help in this.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a farmer with seven years of experience. She lives in a rural area in Kitale Western Kenya with her family of four children who are all schooling. She currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand. She produces eggs, milk, and maize for the local market.

Loice has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. She plans to have a flock of two thousand birds and four quality dairy cows. However, she mentions animal diseases as the main challenge she faces in the business.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa  is married and has four children. In Elmina, she sells fruit and maize in small and large quantities which she has done for four years. Her husband is a tailor. Abenawa uses her income to help her partner to pay utility bills. 

Abenawa will use the loan to purchase a variety of fruit, like oranges, and bags of maize for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abenawa plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase variety of fruit, like oranges, and bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is 62 years old. He lives his wife and three children at the house that he owns.

The only source of income for the family is a taxi service, a business that he has been engaged in for 30 years. His son works in rotation with him in their car to help Tahir in supporting the family. They plan to renew the car. But the first reason for the loan is home repair. He has applied for 1000 AZN to buy construction materials and start the repairs that will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make home repairs.

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru: Хайринисо проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ей 66 лет. Она живет с мужем. Ее сын находится на заработках за рубежом. Хайринисо домохозяйка. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки, чтобы начать свою деятельность у себя дома. Хайринисо намерена заняться шитьем национальных платьев. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина.
texts.en:
Khayriniso lives in the region of J. Rumy. She is 66 years old and lives with her husband. Her son is working abroad. Khayriniso is a homemaker. 

She is taking a loan to buy a sewing machine to start her own activities from her home. Khayriniso intends to sew national dresses. She is a very hardworking woman.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru: Мастона жительница города Дангара. Она 33 - летняя замужняя женщина. Мастона является матерью четверых детей. Она занимается растениеводством. Мастона берет кредит для переработки земли и выращивания овощей. Растениеводством Мастона занимается шесть лет.
texts.en:
Mastona is a resident of the town of Dangara.  She is a 33-year-old, married woman. Mastona is the mother of four children. 

She is engaged in raising crops. Mastona is taking a loan to prepare the land and grow vegetables. She has six years experience in growing crops.

loans.use: to prepare land and buy seeds

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.ru: Махабат 35 лет, замужем , воспитывает 5 детей, младшая дочка новорожденная. Махабат в качестве основного дохода с 1990 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом купив одну корову. Землю Махабат получила после развала СССР. Где ежегодно сажают фасоль и картофель. Благодаря упорному труду Махабат и её семьи  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 30 голов овец и 2 козы. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 3,500 сом KGS от продажи молока и молочной продукции. Доход от полеводства  позволяет приобрести овец и быков в конце сезона. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махабат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и оплату услуг на подготовку поля к весеннему посеву. Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины в целях откорма и увеличение дохода от продажи молока , чтобы накопить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en:
Mahabat is 35 years old, married, and is raising five children, the youngest daughter of which is a newborn. 

As a main source of income since 1990, Mahabat has been engaged in raising livestock and agriculture, starting with 15,000 Som and the purchase of one cow. Mahabat received land before the breakup of the USSR where she does annual planting of beans and potatoes. Through hard work, Mahabat and her family currently have in their household one dairy cow, a horse, 30 sheep, and two goats. Monthly income from the business is 3,500 Som KGS from the sale of milk and dairy products. Income from growing crops allows her to buy sheep and cattle at the end of the season. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Mahabat appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som (KGS) to buy livestock and to pay for preparation of her land for seeding.  Mahabat plans to use income from the loan to invest in further expanding the count of domestic livestock for fattening and an increase in income from the sale of milk, with the goal of saving money for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase cows and sheep and to pay for field preparation for seeding

loans.name: Jeanne Nepomuscene

texts.en: Jeanne Nepomuscene is a mother of two children. She sells both locally-made beers and brewery-made. She wants the loan, to buy more beers for sale. With the profits from the business, she will make savings.

loans.use: to buy more beers for resale.

loans.name: Kholmirzo

texts.ru: Холмирзо проживает в городе Дангара. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Холмирзо занимается частным извозом. Этим видом деятельности он занимается семь лет. Холмирзо берет кредит для ремонта своего легкового автомобиля, чтобы продолжить свою работу.
texts.en:
Kholmirzo lives in the town of Dangara. He is 46 years old, married, and has two children. Kholmirzo is engaged as a taxi driver. He has been doing this kind of work for seven years. 

Kholmirzo is taking a loan to repair his passenger vehicle, in order to continue his work.

loans.use: to repair his passenger vehicle

loans.name: Komba

texts.en:
Kumba is 49 years old and lives in Buchanan. She’s married and has eleven children between the ages of 8 and 22. They are attending school and living at home, and her husband is pastoring a church. For the past six years she has been into the business of selling rice, popcorn, bread, and candy. She enjoys the business because she makes a lot of profit.

Kumba is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, popcorn, bread and candy to resell. She hopes to build a house for her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, popcorn, bread and candy to resell.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is a married woman and a mother of four grown children. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for several years. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and pig feed.

Lucresia dreams of expanding her hog raising business in the future, in order to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells kenkey (fermented maize dough) at Dompoase, near Elmina. She is a single parent, who has seven children. Aba has been selling kenkey for the past five years. As a single parent, she is responsible for the general up-keep of her children, and so she uses her income for that. Whatever she has left, she saves for the future or reinvests in the business. She will use her loan to buy maize, for the production of kenkey to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize, for the production of kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 40 years old, married, and has five children. He owns a carpentry workshop in Muhoroni, which he has been doing for eight years earning an income of 5,000 KES.  

Maurice is requesting his third loan from KADET LTD for 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase timber for his workshop. He will use the profits to invest in his business and repay the loan.  He hopes to expand his workshop and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
Obdulia, de 42 años, vive con su  esposo y 4 hijos en su propia casa, ubicada en la localidad del Tambo. Desde  hace 5 años tiene un negocio estable, la venta de golosinas en una escuela cerca de su casa, ahí ella obtiene durante el años el ingreso estable que requiere su casa. Pero el trabajo al que hace poco incursionó y al que desea incrementar el capital económico, es la venta de animales, en principal ovejas pequeñas de buena calidad. Las cuales comercializa en la feria ganadera que se desarrolla todos los fines de semana en la ciudad. Espera dentro de muy poco manejar mayor capital de dinero para comprar más ovejas y revenderlas a mayor precio, pues tiene ya muchos clientes a los cuales desea brindarles ovejas de mejor calidad. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias, además el préstamo será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica.
Obdulia, invertirá el dinero en la compra de 40 ovejas para realizar su negocio de compra y venta.
texts.en:
Obdulia, who is 42 years old, lives with her husband and 4 children in their own home which is located in the Tambo area. For the past 5 years she has run a business selling sweets at a nearby school. This business is stable and it provides the regular income that she needs for her household. 

However, a short while ago she started working in another activity: the sale of animals, principally good quality lambs. It is for this that she wants to increase her economic capital. She sells them at the livestock market held in the city every weekend. In the short-term she hopes to have higher capital in order to buy more sheep and sell them at a higher price. She already has many customers and she would like to be able to supply them with better quality sheep.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy in the knowledge that she has financial support. Furthermore she enjoys being part of her communal bank as all of the members are responsible and supportive, Also the loan will be very useful in helping to progress this economic activity.

Obdulia will invest the money in the purchase of 40 sheep for her animal trade business.

loans.use: to buy 40 sheep

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 44 years old. She sells different items in her store. With the loan, she wants to buy more sugar, rice, and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a father of three children and has been in the farming business for six successive years, in his rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya. He runs his farm with the help of one farmhand, currently, and he sells his produce of milk, eggs and tomatoes.

William has requested a loan of 36,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, to buy and insure a dairy cow. He aspires to run a farm of five, good-quality dairy cows.  In addition, he wants to establish a grain milling machine in the local market, for additional income.

William says the shortage of animal feeds remains the major challenge to him. He says the income from the new dairy cow will help boost his family business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 60 years old and has two adult children. She sells bananas, which she has been doing for 10 years. Immaculee is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more bananas to sell. She will use the profits to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a mother of four young children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a mobile phone electronic reloading business for sometime now. This is the source of her income.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy more electronic load so that she will be able to have more customers. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more electronic load

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 34 year old egg supplier and an Mpesa agent in Saba Saba, Mombasa. She is a single lady who has been in this business for the last six years. Her monthly income is 100,000, and she will use the loan to purchase more eggs to sell and to increase her Mpesa float.

The anticipated profit will be used to expand her business to other surrounding centers. This is her second loan after repaying the first one successfully. She hopes to prosper and own rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs to sell and to increase her Mpesa float.

loans.name: María Irene

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, reside junto a sus 3 hijos menores en una comunidad del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortes.
María se dedicaba a la venta de tortillas, con algunos ahorros logro establecer hace 2 años un puesto de comida donde vende pollo frito, carne asada, chuletas, todo acompañado con tajadas de banano verde, frijoles fritos y ensaladas verdes.
Con el fin de aumentar sus ventas, decidió solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de carnes, verduras, frijoles, condimentos y bananos verdes.
Con el apoyo financiero lograra obtener una mejoría en sus ventas y sus ingresos, los que piensa seguir invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: María, 47, is a single mother; she has four children and lives with the three younger ones in a community in San Pedro Sula, Cortes Department.  She used to sell tortillas but with some savings she had she managed to open a food stand two years ago where she sells fried chicken, grilled meat and chops; everything is served with fried green plantain, refried beans and green salad.  In order to increase sales, she decided to request a 5,000 Lempira loan that she plans to use to buy meats, vegetables, beans, condiments and green plantains.  With financial support, she will improve sales and income that she plans to continue to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy food items like meat, plantain, vegetables and beans.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María, tiene 32 años de edad, casada con tres hijos, y viven en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene 1 año de tener una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar todo lo que es abarrotes, carnes, verduras, refrescos, granos básicos, pan y otros como tamales. Este negocio es el único que hay en la zona donde vive y está haciendo buena clientela. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos comestibles para la venta, como ser carnes verduras, granos básicos, manteca, refrescos, pan y otros. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en: María, 32, is married with three children; they live in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  She’s had a grocery store for a year where she sells basic staple items like groceries, meats, vegetables, soft-drinks, basic grains, bread and others like tamales.  This business is the only one in the area where she lives so she’s acquiring a good clientele.  The loan she’s requested is for 10,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy more food items like vegetables, basic grains, lard, soft-drinks, bread and others, to sell.   Her goal is to make the business grow to help with her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet, de 41 años, vive con su esposo  y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada, desde hace 5 años. Desde hace 4 años ella y su esposo tienen una consultoría  que consiste en realizar proyectos de instalaciones de servicio de agua potable y alcantarillado de las diversas comunidades de la costa del país, la actividad que tienen le resulta beneficiosa, pues su cónyuge es ingeniero de profesión, es está razón por la que sus potenciales clientes acudan para que  ofrezcan el servicio. Durante todo este tiempo de trabajo ha visto las grandes ventajas en sus ganancias que beneficia su economía por lo que ha decidido  mejorar las instalaciones de su pequeña oficina que ha implementado en su casa. Además de poner muy pronto una sucursal en su casa de la empresa de saneamiento para desarrollar las obras en esta parte del país. Por otro lado espera mejorar sus ingresos en el restaurante que posee, ya que su otra pasión en la preparación de comida, ella es chef de profesión. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias, además el préstamo será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica.
Janet, invertirá el dinero en implementar la oficina de su casa, para los proyectos de saneamiento que piensa realizar con la gobernación de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Janet, 41, has lived with her husband and two children in a rented house for five years.  For the last four years, she and her husband have had a consulting firm working in potable water and drainage installations in various communities along the country’s coast.  The activity they have is profitable because her spouse is an engineer by profession and this is why their potential clients come to them for services.  In all this time they’ve been working she’s seen the great advantages her profits bring to her economy which is why she’s decided to improve her small home-based office’s facilities in addition to very soon installing a branch office of the drainage firm to start projects in this part of the country.  On the other hand, she also hopes to improve income from the restaurant she owns because her other passion is cooking; she’s a chef by profession.

This is her second MFP loan and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support.  It pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.  In addition, the loan will be very useful for her economic activity’s progress.  Janet will use the money to furnish her home office for the drainage projects she’s planning with city government.

loans.use: to furnish her office.

loans.name: Tonia

texts.en:
Tonia lives in Buchanan, the capital city of Ground Bassa County, which is a fishing center. She is a Junior High school student and has four children, who are between 2 and 13 years old. All of the children live at home, and three are attending school.

For the past four years Tonia has been selling rubber dishes, like plates, bowls and cups, in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for resale.

She wishes to build her own house and educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes, like plates, bowls and cups, to resell in the market.

loans.name: Bardhi

texts.en:
Bardhi, who is a Roma man, is a 42-year-old married father of three, and all of them live in a major city in south central Albania. He is a bricklayer and learned this profession when he immigrated to Greece and lived there for over eight years. Bardhi’s skills are in need because construction in recent years has been booming in Albania; thus, he always finds himself busy.

Bardhi wants to repair his own little house this winter, and he hopes that lenders will provide him the loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek he is requesting from Kiva. It will be the first loan for him, yet people in his community have spoken very highly of his personable and responsible nature; thus, he will pay the loan back and on time.

loans.use: To repair his little family house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Buchanan, the capital city of Ground Bassa County, noted for producing fish. She is widow and has five children ages 4 to 15. They all live at home, and four of them are attending school. 

For the past 11 years, Mary has been selling fish in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. One problem is that some of her customers don’t  pay on time. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase fish for her business. She hopes to educate her children and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo, de 32 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa Miriam y su hija Vameri a la que cuidan en su casa propia, donde vive desde hace 2 años.  Desde las primeras horas del día, muy temprano sale a preparar la tierra que le servirá para la realización de ladrillos, su jornada es muy pesada pues tiene que trabajar sin descanso hasta el último rayo de sol. Comenta que desde niño aprendió todo lo necesario para la realización de ladrillos, con el tiempo aprendió también a fabricar tejas, en la actualidad elabora 13 millares al mes los cuales tiene comprador fijo, pues él es un hombre con muchos contactos, a pesar de su edad tiene mucha experiencia en este ámbito. “Gracias a mi es fuerzo, pude construir mi propia casa, en buenas condiciones, espero muy pronto terminar los últimos acabados”, afirma. Ahora comenta, se encuentra aprovechando los últimos rayos de sol, pues comienza la temporada de lluvia y los ladrillos tardan en secar.  Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo recibido ya que durante todo este tiempo pudo dinamizar sus ingresos y mantener a su negocio en buenas condiciones financieras. Es así que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Arnaldo, invertirá el dinero en la compra de arcilla, ramas y demás insumos para la elaboración de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is 32 years old and is a responsible man. He lives with his wife, Miriam and their daughter, Vameri, who they raise in their own home where they have lived for the past two years. 

From the early hours at the very start of the day, he goes out to prepare the earth that he uses to make bricks. He does a hard day's graft, working without a break until the sun sets. He says that he learnt everything he needed to make bricks from a young age, and with time he also learnt how to make roof tiles. Today, he makes 13 thousand a month for regular customers, because he has many contacts, and despite his age he has a lot of experience in this field.

“Thanks to my efforts, I was able to build my own house, in good condition, and I hope to put the finishing touches to it soon." he explains. At the moment he says he is making the most of every last ray of sunlight, because the rainy season starts soon and the bricks take a while to dry. 

This is his third loan with MFP, and he is grateful for the support he has received, because throughout all this time he was able to boost his income and keep his business in good financial condition. He promises to make his loan repayments on time.

Arnaldo will use the money to buy clay, twigs and other materials to make bricks.

loans.use: to buy clay, twigs, and other materials to make bricks.

loans.name: Fayez

texts.en:
Fayez is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his elder son, Ramadan, appears in his Kiva profile photo. The photo was taken in the workshop.

Fayez is a 52-year-old man. He is married and a father to three sons. His wife is a UN employee who gets a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past year, Fayez has had a workshop for repairing electronics and reselling these electronics to customers. His elder son, Ramadan, is helping him in operating the workshop which has been a profitable business and is considered as the main source of income to the family.

Fayez is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new repair kit and improving the workshop's condition by installing new tiles. This will improve the workshop's condition and improve the quality of repairing electronics which will attract more customers and will increase sales and the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase a new repair kit and improve the workshop's condition.

loans.name: Emelienne

texts.en: Emelienne is 58 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has spent two years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans for sale.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise, 53, is a mother of four children. All of them go to school. She sells shoes, both used and newly-made shoes. She has spent five years in the business. With the loan, she wants to add more different kinds of shoes for sale. She plans to use the profits for paying her children’s school expenses.

loans.use: To add more different kinds of shoes to her inventory.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 28 years old, married, and blessed with three children who are 8, 4, and 2 years old. He is a farmer, and he brings his farm produce to the nearby markets for sale. He has been in operation for a period of over four years, earning an income of KES 40,000.  

He is taking his third loan of KES 73,000 from KADET LTD, after having repaid the previous loan successfully. He intends to use this amount to purchase more fresh maize from other local farmers, for resale.  

He will use the profits he earns to repay the loan and to plow back into his business.  He hopes to prosper in business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase fresh maize from other local farmers, for resale at the nearby markets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food for sale.

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “El Rosario” que conforman 09 socios  que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio que pasan al ciclo 17. Lidia tiene 42 años, casada con 05 hijos de la cual 02 de ellos en etapa escolar. Lidia se dedica hace 2 años a la venta de ropa nueva y cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Lidia ha solicitado el préstamo para comprar medias, brasier, polos y pantalones. Una de las metas de Lidia es poder arreglar su casa para que sus hijos tengan mejor calidad de vida. Lidia está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Kiva. Lidia se encuentra ubicada en la parte de atrás es la cuarta del lado izquierdo, viste polo morado.
texts.en:
This is the “El Rosario” group, made up of 9 members who work in various businesses. They are in their 17th loan cycle. Lidia is 42 years old, married, with five children, two of whom are school-aged. 

Lidia has worked selling new clothing for two years and has loyal customers. Lidia has applied for the loan to buy stockings, bras, T-shirts,  and pants. 

One of Lidia's goals is to be able to fix her house so that that her children can have a better quality of life. Lidia is very happy about this loan and is grateful to Kiva. 

Lidia appears in the back part of the photo. She is fourth from the left, wearing a purple T-shirt.

loans.use: To buy stockings, bras, T-shirts and pants.

loans.name: Elsury

texts.es:
Elsury, de 29 años, nació en Medellín, Colombia. Elsury realizó una técnica de auxiliar de laboratorio clínico en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje –SENA- entidad pública de Colombia, que le permitió comenzar su vida laboral para financiar sus estudios de nutrición y dietética en la Universidad Pública de Antioquia. Durante su carrera, Elsury comenzó a interesarse por las áreas de nutrición pública e investigación de los factores de la estructura social que condicionan el estado nutricional y de salud de la población. 

Actualmente Elsury trabaja en investigación y es profesora en una universidad. Sin embargo, su salario es muy bajo y no es suficiente para cumplir su sueño de realizar la maestría en salud comunitaria.

La ayuda de Kiva permitirá que Elsury cumpla su sueño de realizar su posgrado de tal forma que  pueda ampliar sus conocimientos en los determinantes de las inequidades en salud, conocer otras culturas, perfeccionar sus conocimientos de francés e inglés, crecer como profesional, como persona y contribuir al desarrollo de su país.  

Aquí esta su historia:

Desde niña he tenido un alto sentido social y he deseado adquirir conocimientos que me permitan favorecer el bienestar de las demás personas. Gracias a mi trabajo y mi dedicación tuve la posibilidad de realizar mis estudios técnicos y universitarios en entidades públicas de mi país, esto hizo que en mi se acrecentara la necesidad de contribuir al desarrollo de la nación y al mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida sus habitantes.
 
Lograr este objetivo es lo que me impulsa a estudiar los determinantes de las inequidades en salud y me motiva a realizar la maestría de salud comunitaria en una de las mejores universidades de Canadá, pues los conocimientos y las experiencias que adquiera me ayudaran a crecer como profesional, como persona y lo más importante, me dará las herramientas para servir a la sociedad y lograr que las políticas públicas en salud y nutrición que se realicen sean más efectivas.  

Durante toda mi vida he procurado desarrollar todas mis capacidades, he luchado por hacer realidad mis sueños y he logrado cumplirlos, debido al amor y la energía que le imprimo a cada cosa que hago. 
Estoy convencida que cuando una persona pone todo su esfuerzo y es perseverante logra superar todos los obstáculos. Desde que decidí realizar mi posgrado se me han presentado muchas dificultades, que estoy segura, lograré solucionar teniendo el apoyo y la ayuda de Kiva.
texts.en:
Elsury, 29, was born in Medellín, Colombia.  Elsury prepared to be an assistant clinical laboratory technician in the Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje, a public institution in Colombia.  This allowed her to begin working to finance her studies in nutrition and dietetics at the University of Antioquia.  During her program, Elsury began to become interested in the areas of public nutrition and research on the social factors that determine the state of community nutrition and health.  

Currently Elsury works in research and is a professor in a university.  Nevertheless, her salary is very low and it's not enough to realize her dream of undertaking the master's degree in community health.

The help of Kiva will allow Elsury to achieve her dream of finishing her graduate work so she can expand her knowledge of determiners of health inequality, get to know other cultures, perfect her knowledge of French and English, grow as a professional and as a person, and contribute to the development of her country.

Here's her story:

"Since I was a little girl I've had a high social sense and have wanted to learn about the well-being of others.  Thanks to my job and my dedication I had the possibility of undertaking my technical and university studies in public institutions in my country.  This increased my need to contribute to national development and to the improvement of the living conditions of the population.

"Realizing this goal is what drives me to study the determiners of health inequality and motivates me to undertake the master's in community health in one of the best universities in Canada.  The knowledge and experiences I will acquire will help me to grow as a professional and as a person.  More importantly, they will give me the tools to serve society and assure that public health and nutrition policies will be more effective.

"Throughout my entire life I have sought to develop all my abilities, I have strived to make my dreams come true, and I have managed to realize them because of the love and energy I put into everything I do.

"I am convinced that when people put all their effort into something and are perseverant, they manage to overcome all the obstacles.  Since I decided to do my master's degree, I have faced many difficulties that I am sure I will be able to resolve by having the support and the help of Kiva."

loans.use: to pay the application fees for her master's degree in community health

loans.name: Mamur

texts.ru: Маъмур в нашей организации кредитуется первый цикл. Он добросовестный, целеустремлённый и трудолюбивый мужчина. Он родился в сельской местности, который имеет хорошее условие для животноводства и выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур. Его сыновья находятся в России, но не имеют постоянной место работы, поэтому Маъмур не надеется на денежные переводы сыновей и сам занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур, так как имеет достаточного опыта по скотоводству и земледелием. В основном она выращивает пшеницу, ячмень и кукуруза. Маъмур на полученный урожай покупает скот из базара на низкие цены,  и на определённое время откармливает скот и перепродаёт по высокой цене. Скот держит за счёт кормов произведённых его самым. По ведению бизнеса Маъмуру помогает его жена. На полученный доход от бизнеса Маъмур улучшил условию своего домохозяйство. В этом году  Маъмур посеял на 5 гектара земли ячменя, пшеницы и кукурузу, однако из-за неблагополучной погоды Маъмур не мог получить намеченный урожай. Поэтому он обращался в нашу организацию с целью получения займа на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения свадьбы сына. Его сын хочет женится на любимой девушки и создать хорошую семью.  Маъмур надеется на Вашу благотворительность.
texts.en:
This is Mamur's first loan with our organization. He is a conscientious, goal-focused, and hardworking man. He was born in a rural area with good conditions for crop cultivation and raising livestock. 

Mamur's son is currently in Russia, but he doesn't have consistent source of work. So Mamur cannot count on having money sent home by his son and works himself, raising crops and animals. As a result, he has a fair amount of experience in animal husbandry and agriculture. His main crops are wheat, barley and corn. Mamur uses his harvested crops to buy livestock at the market for low prices. He then fattens the animals up for a certain period of time, and resells the livestock at high prices. The livestock is maintained by feed that Mamur himself grows. Mamur's wife helps him run the business.

With the income he makes from his business, Mamur has improved his living conditions. This year Mamur planted 5 hectacres of barley, wheat and corn. However, because of unfortunate weather, his harvest was less than anticipated. 

That's why he has applied to our organization for a loan of 3000 somoni so he can pay for his son's wedding. His son wants to marry the woman he loves and start a good family. Mamur is counting on your generosity.

loans.use: to host his son's wedding.

loans.name: Violah

texts.en:
Violah is 27 years old, married, and has two children, ages seven and two years. She is a business lady in Kapsabet, selling cereals (grains). She has been in operation for a period of one year, earning an income of KES 9,000.

She has taken her first loan, in the amount of KES 30,000, from KADET LTD. She intends to purchase dried beans and maize for resale. 

The profits earned will be used to pay school fees for her children, and plowed back into her business. Violah hopes for prosperity in her business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted cereals and dried beans for resale

loans.name: Marie Josee

texts.en: Marie Josee is 48 years old. She owns a retail store and has been running the business for the past 22 years. With the loan, she will buy more sugar, rice, maize flour and bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, maize flour and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man, 29 years old, and he has four children, ages 12, 10, 8, and 5 years. He owns a workshop and has been in operation for a period of eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000.  

Samuel is servicing his second loan of KES 45,000 from KADET LTD, after having repaid the previous loan successfully. He intends to use this amount to purchase iron bars, to use for making steel windows and doors.  

The profits he gets will be used to purchase a plot of land and develop it. He hopes to educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy iron bars, to use for making windows and doors.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is married and is 47 years old. She has three children between the ages of 15 and 25 years old.  She runs a retail shop in Kapsabet and has been in operation for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 10,000.

Noel is requesting her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. and intends to use this amount to purchase sugar, rice, and wheat flour for her business.  

The profits she earns will be used to put back into her business and repay the loan.  Noel hopes to live a happily and prosper in business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of sugar, rice, and flour for her retail shop

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en: Tenneh is 24 years old and lives in the airport area. She is single and has a 4-year-old child who is currently in school and lives at home. For the past six years, Tenneh been selling sweet meat (cooked and well-seasoned cow meat). She faces some problems during the rainy season. She started selling for her mother and for herself. She is requesting a loan to purchase cow meat for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cow meat for her business,

loans.name: Carine

texts.en: Carine is age 40. She is a mother of eight children between the ages of 2 and 12 years old. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past 13 years. With this loan, Carine plans to add more clothes commonly known as Bitenge to increase the volume of her sales. The profits from her business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Tenneh is 45 years old and lives in the airport community. She is married and has five children between 15 and 26 years old. 

For the past nine years Tenneh has been selling charcoal. She faces some problems during the rainy season. Tenneh borrowed money from her friend to start her business and she learned the business from her aunt. Tenneh is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business,

loans.name: Vivianne

texts.en: Vivianne is 30 years old. She sells different items in her boutique. She wants the loan to add more rice, and sugar for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business in order to make more profits in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rice and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Muthusi

texts.en: His business has continued to witness growth. He was able to stock his shop and provided health care to the residents of the area and this assisted him to educate his children. Muthusi looks forward to opening a medical clinic in the near future. Muthusi is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to purchase drugs and also establish a laboratory.

loans.use: to purchase more medications.

loans.name: Refik

texts.en:
Refik is 28 years old, married, and the father of five children. The children are three boys and two girls, ranging in age from 1 to 10 years. Two of them go to school. The family lives together in a minority community in Kosovo. 

Since 2005 Refik has worked in his own business, carrying wood for others, using his horse. This is the main income source for his family. Refik is a very hard-working man, who works a lot to support his family. He uses his horse to carry wood in his area. The money he earns from this season he must save, also, for the spring and summer seasons when he does not have a lot of work to do.
 
Recently the family moved into a new house in another place, and Refik wants to build a new stable for his horse. He is requesting a loan of 1,300 EUR in order to build a new stable for his horse. The loan will help him to have a place for the horse and to continue his business, which is very fruitful in this cold weather. He hopes in the future to ensure a better life for his family. His goal is to give a better education to his children. He is very grateful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To build a new stable for his horse

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en: This is Victoire, age 47. She sells various items in her general store. She wants the loan to buy more soap, bananas, potatoes, and cooking oil, to resell in the store. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: To add more soaps, bananas and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Denyse

texts.en:
Denyse is aged 23 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for two years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more rice, sugar and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to add more value in her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and salt for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La Señora Dominga tiene 58  años de edad,  convive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos, reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad del Municipio de Arizona, Departamento de Atlántida.
Dominga hace 20 años que se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios a través de una pulpería.
Con el propósito de surtir su negocio y ofrecer variedad de productos alimenticios ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad de 7000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, productos de limpieza, condimentos, golosinas y refrescos.
Ella espera seguir mejorando su calidad de vida a través de las ganancias que obtiene.
texts.en:
Sra. Dominga is 58 years old. She and her husband are in a common-law relationship and have two children. They reside in a community in the town of Arizona, Department of Atlántida.

For the past 20 years, Dominga has been selling food products from her convenience store. She plans to restock her business and offer a variety of food products, so she decided to request a loan in the amount of 7,000 HNL. Dominga plans to buy rice, beans, sugar, eggs, cleaning products, condiments, snack foods, and soft drinks.

She hopes to continue improving her quality of life with the income that she will generate.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, eggs, cleaning products, condiments, snack foods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Crsito Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cristo Rey es un comité muy activo y antiguo,  siempre saben salir adelante, y es gracias al trabajo y al apoyo de las unas con las otras se encuentran en el ciclo 17.
La Sra. Maria es la presidenta de este grupo, y cuenta que su grupo ha pasado ya por muchos ciclos, pero que se encuentran cada vez más, con mayor entusiasmo y quieren poder seguir trabajando y luchando por sus sueños. Maria es modista, y solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas e hilos.
Cuenta Maria que tiene ya muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene muy buenos trabajos y se esfuerza por hacerlos, ya que sabe que esa es su mejor publicidad. Ella y sus amigas del grupo están contentas por seguir trabajando juntas.
texts.en:
The Cristo Rey group is a very active and longstanding committee whose members always work to get ahead, thanks to their work and mutual support.  They are in their 17th cycle.

Maria is the group’s president and tells us that her group has already crossed many cycles, but they have more enthusiasm each time and they want to keep working toward their dreams.  Maria is a fashion stylist and is asking for this loan to buy fabrics and thread.

Maria says that she has many customers because she always does good work and works toward it because she knows that it’s her greatest asset.  She and her friends from the group are happy about continuing to work together.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie lives in airport community, she is married and her husband is a business man. They have four children between 3 to 15 years old. Since 2008 she has been selling lapper (fabric) in the local market. She likes how people respond to her business and the interaction of people. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lapper (fabric) for her business. She plans to buy her land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more lapper (fabric) for her business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La Sra. Valentina es de Ciudad del Este, tiene una  hija Mayor, Estudiante Universitaria. Valentina tiene un puesto de venta en la feria de ciudad del este donde se dedica a la comercialización de verduras y  producción de quesos.
Gracias al trabajo que está realizando ayuda a su hija a cursar la universidad  y compra todas las necesidades de su hogar. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y ha demostrado que trabaja duro para poder cumplir con todas sus obligaciones.
Ella solicita del crédito para la compra de materias primas para la producción de sus quesos y también de verduras, para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo sus metas.
texts.en:
Valentina is from the city of Este and has an adult daughter who is a university student.  Valentina has a stall at the city fair, where she sells fruits and cheeses.

Thanks to her work, she is able to help her daughter finish her university studies and pay for all the household needs.  She is a dedicated person who has demonstrated that she works hard to meet her obligations. 

She is asking for this loan to buy raw materials to produce her cheeses, and also vegetables so that she can continue working to meet her goals.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 46 years old and has seven children who all go to school.  She sells foodstuffs. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice, sugar, and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as rice, sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 29 years old and owns a bar, selling beer. She has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell in her bar.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes es un grupo de la ciudad de Curuguaty, están trabajando arduamente por seguir trabajando y ya están en su tercer ciclo. Demuestran que por medio de su trabajo se puede llegar lejos y poder cumplir con todo lo que se quiere.
Agustina es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar, motiva a sus compañeras del grupo a poder seguir luchando para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que pueden. Agustina comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, y por medio de este trabajo está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar prendas de toda variedad para poder seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is a group from the city of Curuguaty.  The members are working arduously and are in their third cycle.  They have shown that one can go far and do whatever one wants by working hard.

Agustina is the group’s president and is a person with a great desire to get ahead and make progress.  She motivates her fellow members to continue making an effort to provide their families with everything they can.  Agustina says that she sells all types of clothing and gets ahead through this work.

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy different types of clothing so that she can continue giving her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old. She owns a bar. She is married to a farmer and they have both seven children aged between 3 and 19 years old. 

Josephine wants the loan to add more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Mamoud M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from one of the primary schools in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 13,600,000 Leones. With the help of this loan, they are empowered to meet their immediate financial obligations. At the end of each month, they will be able to easily repay the loan by using their monthly salaries. Their school's bursar is directly responsible for performing the deductions and making repayments on their behalf.

David is the featured leader of this group. He is a native of Binkolo village in northern Sierra Leone. David is married to a trader, and the couple has five children – two in primary school and three in secondary school. Now 50 years old, David has been a professional teacher for 27 years. He has requested this loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Miguela es la presidenta de este grupo, y cuenta que todas ellas se esfuerzan y trabajan juntas, son muy conocidas en su barrio por su labor, cada una ayuda a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Están en su sexto ciclo y siguen creciendo.
Miguela vende bebidas de todas clases, como ser vinos, cervezas, gaseosas y demás. En su negocio le está yendo muy bien, pues ya se hizo de clientela que siempre compra de ella sus productos. Está creciendo lentamente, y su sueño es poder seguir agrandando su negocio.
Solicita de este crédito para poder surtir su local con cervezas, vinos, gaseosas y demás. Agradecen todas ellas por la gran oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
Miguela is the president of this group and tells us that all of its members work hard and together.  They are very cordial in their neighborhood because of their work.  Each one helps her families through their work; they are in their sixth cycle, and continue to grow.

Miguela sells drinks of all types such as wine, beer, soft drinks and others.  Things are going well for her in her business and she already has steady customers who buy her products.  She is growing slowly and her dream is to be able to continue growing her business.

She is asking for this loan so that she can stock her store with beer, wine, soft drinks, and other things.  They are all grateful for the great opportunity that they have been getting.

loans.use: to buy drinks of resale.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La Sra. Liliana es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, comenta que gracias al trabajo que hace ha podido mejorar mucho sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia. Además de ser comerciante también tiene una casa de hospedaje que le permite tener mejores ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima como carne, leche, huevo y queso, lo cual le seguirá ayudando para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo nuevamente.
texts.en:
Liliana is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, milk, eggs, and cheese that will help her to invest back into her business.  She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: To buy raw materials (meat, milk, eggs and cheese)

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 40 years old and lives in the area of Airport. She’s married and has six children between the ages of 1 and 21. Four attend school and they all live at home. Rebecca's husband is a businessman. For the past 12 years, she has been in the charcoal business. She enjoys the business because she makes a lot of profit. Rebecca is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to resell. She hopes to build a house for her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is single and owns a beauty salon which she has been operating for over a year. She also earns some income from formal employment. 
Nancy learned about Milango through a friend and joined to access credit and improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing is competition and lack of enough capital to expand the business. She feels the situation will improve with this new loan she is applying for.  
Nancy is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to buy additional cosmetics, hair products, tongs, flat irons, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her acquire a college education.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics, hair products, tongs, flat irons, etc.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
Madeleine is aged 26. She sells shoes. Her husband works as a businessman. 

Madeleine wants the loan to buy more shoes for sale.The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business, as well as add more attractive things for her business to grow much better in the future.

loans.use: to add more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
En su cuarto ciclo se encuentra este grupo de 10 integrantes, cada una de ellas tiene su actividad, pero también hacen actividades en grupo para poder ayudarse y seguir creciendo como grupo. Gracias a la ayuda que están recibiendo han podido mejorar un poco y quieren seguir haciéndolo.
Graciela, miembro de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de verduras, tiene un pequeño puesto desde donde se gana el sustento para su familia. Es una persona que no se cansa de luchar por su familia, y es por eso que está saliendo adelante y creciendo.
Graciela pide de este crédito, para la compra de verduras, como ser locotes, tomates, cebollas y demás. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group of ten members is in its fourth cycle and each one has her own business but they also do some activities as a group.  Thanks to the help they receive, they have been able to improve and continue to do it.

Graciela, a member of this group, sells vegetables and has a small stall where she earns a living for her family.  She is a person who does not tire of working for her family and this is why she is getting ahead and growing.

Graciela is asking for this loan to buy vegetables such as squash, tomatoes, onions, and others.  She is grateful for the help she is receiving toward getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en: Nathan is an adult male. He is married to Mary, with whom he has five children. All of them are in school. Nathan also lives with his 90-year-old father and takes care of his father's medical bills because of his advanced age. Nathan works on his sugarcane plantation for at least eight hours a day for six days each week. He rears pigs and goats to supplement his income. Nathan will use these means to earn the money to pay back the loan which he is acquiring to buy building materials to complete his residential house in the countryside. He is excited that he and his children will finally have a decent house to live in. The house they are living in now is quite small, and they have to share it with his father which has been quite a challenge. Nathan is hard-working. He devotes his time to several economic activities so he is sure that he will do a fine job paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy building materials to complete his residential house

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus 2 Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de la Sra. Diana y Perla, quienes  fueron las que  reunieron  a sus vecinas, las señoras  decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida. El grupo tiene 21 miembros que trabajan arduamente.
Nancy, miembro de este grupo, cuenta que se dedica a la venta de tortas, en lo que le está yendo muy bien. Sus tortas son muy aceptadas y solicitadas por sus clientes, por lo que le gustaría poder seguir trabajando. Nancy, es una persona con muchas ansias de seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante para poder crecer y ayudar a su familia a que tengan todo lo que necesitan.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de harina, huevos, manteca, dulce de leche y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las tortas que vende. 
Este es un grupo muy trabajador y emprendedor.
texts.en:
This group was formed by Diana and Perla, who got the neighbors together, who decided to work together to get ahead and improve their qualities of life.  The group has 21 members who get together very often.

Nancy is a member of this group and sells sandwiches.  Things are going well for her and her sandwiches are well accepted and requested by her customers, so she would like to keep working.  Nancy is a woman with a great desire to continue working and get ahead so that she can grow and help her family have what they need.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy flour, eggs, lard, dulce de leche, and other ingredients to continue making the sandwiches that she sells.

This is a very hardworking and enterprising group.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo tiene 28 años, tiene un servicio de alquileres de vajillas y decoraciones, se dedica a este rubro desde el año 2008. Su negocio lo tiene en su casa, y comenta que recibe la ayuda de su esposa, quien siempre está allí para poder ayudarlo, ella es su mayor sostén y apoyo. Es una pareja muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de mesas, silla, manteles   ya que es a fin de año tienen varios pedidos de alquileres y quiere poder tener bastantes de sus utensilios para poder alquilar. El sueña con abrir otro local y dar trabajo a la gente de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Hugo is 28 years old and rents out plates and decorations.  He’s been doing this since 2008 and runs the business out of his home.  He says that his wife helps him and is always there for him.  She is his biggest source of support and encouragement and she is very enterprising and hardworking.

He is asking for this loan to buy tables, chairs, and tablecloths, now that the end of the year is approaching, has many requests for rentals, and wants to be able to have enough to rent out.  He wants to open another branch and provide work for others in the community.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and utensils.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie, 42 years old, lives in Buchanan. She did not go to school. She is married and has five children between the ages of 4 and 23, who are in school and live at home. 

For thirteen years Mamie has been selling rice preparations, like pepper, bitter ball, okra and palm oil, in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother, and learned it from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra and palm oil for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra and palm oil, to resell in the local market.

loans.name: Tetee

texts.en:
Tetee is 35, married and lives in the Kakata community with her three children, who are between the ages of 2 and 7 and are currently in school. 

Tetee is a hardworking mother who has been operating a cookshop (restaurant) for the past ten years. She always has her customers’ favorite dishes. She prepares palm butter, cassava leaves, palava sauce, fufu and soup (made from cassava). 

She sells six days a week and she makes a profit when she sells. With the profit, she buys more goods and contributes to the household expenses. She transports her goods by commercial vehicle. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more ingredients to increase her sales. Her dreams are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to plant 0.5 acres with sorghum and maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more foodstuff for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa produces kenkey (fermented maize dough) for sale at Dompoase near Elimina. She is a single parent with two children.  

Adjoa has been selling kenkey for the past five years. As a single parent, she is responsible for the general upkeep of her children and so uses her income for that. Whatever she has left, she saves for the future and reinvests in the business. 

Her loan will be used to buy maize for the production of kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize for the production of kenkey.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of maize to make more corn dough for sale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 32-year-old married man with a stable family of 3 children. He is a trained teacher with a dream of transforming the lives of poor people by equipping them with vocational and technical skills. Because of his dream he started a vocational institution in the Mbarara municipality, a district in western Uganda, in 2009. The institution has trained many school drop outs in vocational and technical skills. He wants a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy computers to enable him to train students in computer skills as well as vocational skills. He has a dream of making his institution one of the leading vocational institutions around Mbarara, specializing in training underprivileged students from poor families to make their survival a success.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Ahorrar Es Exito Group

texts.es: Cordiales Saludos!!! Este es la nueva Alcancía Comunal “Ahorrar Es Éxito” la cual está conformada por 06 socios entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar con el Programa-Prosperidad. Siendo Rosa una de las integrantes, casada y tiene 03 hijos independientes. A sus 35 años Rosa ha llegado a cumplir algunos de sus sueños como mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos en su educación. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de ceviche la cual lo realiza  ambulatoriamente. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo a podido comprar su terreno. Su reciente préstamo lo destinara para la compra de insumos como cebolla, limón, aceite y papas y de esta manera poder preparar su ceviche. Construir su vivienda es su mayor deseo. El nuevo grupo “Ahorrar Es Éxito” agradecen el crédito brindado.  Rosa es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste una casaca a cuadros.
texts.en:
Greetings!  This is “Ahorrar Es Éxito” communal bank, which is made up of six enthusiastic members who have started working with the “Prosperidad” program.  Rosa is one of the members, is married, and has three adult children on their own.  At 35 years old, Rosa has managed to achieve some wishes, such as making improvements to her home and support her children in their education.

Currently she sells ceviche on foot.  The fruits of her labor have allowed her to buy a plot of land.  She will use the money from this loan to buy onions, lemons, cooking oil, and potatoes.  In this way she can prepare her ceviche.  One of her great desires is to build her house.  This new group, “Ahorrar Es Éxito” is grateful for the loans.  Rosa is the second from the left, wearing a top with squares on it.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience sells slippers and sandals in Dompoase, near Elmina. She is married and has 4 children. Patience uses her income to support her husband in clothing and feeding  their children. Patience will use her loan to purchase slippers and sandals to sell. She will use the new profit to acquire a shop for the sale of her goods.

loans.use: to purchase slippers and sandals to sell

loans.name: Sarah Mama

texts.en: Sarah Mama has been selling secondhand ladies' and children's dresses for 3 years. She is single and she uses her income to pay her utility and accommodation bills. Sarah needs this loan to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses to sell. Sarah plans to expand her business with the new profit from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a single parent, who takes care of six children. She sells maize and corn dough at Elmina, which she has done for four years. As a single parent, she uses the income she makes from the sale of dough to educate her children. Efua will use the loan to purchase bags of maize and corn dough to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize and corn dough to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married to a farmer and has five children. Ama is a baker, and she also cooks kenkey and rice for sale, serving them with fried fish and vegetable stew. She assists her husband in paying utility bills and educating their children. 

Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, flour and other ingredients, to use in preparing her food to sell. She will use her new profit for an oven, to expand her bakery business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, flour and other ingredients, to use in preparing her food to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 39 años, vive al lado de sus 2 hijas en una casa arrendada, ubicada en la localidad del Tambo. Desde hace 4 años que tiene su  negocio de restaurante, donde ella misma prepara los alimentos y sus hijos la apoyan en la atención y servicio a los clientes, atiende desayunos y almuerzos. Ya por la tarde descansa, le agrada su trabajo; ya que siempre dispone de la comida de cada día, los platos que prepara son muy ricos. Pues su secreto es, la pasión con lo que elabora cada ingrediente de la comida. Además, le gusta cocinar a aunque reconoce que, en varias oportunidades, se sintió cansada ya que el trabajo es sacrificado y requiere de mucho tiempo, su negocio ha crecido con el tiempo y está muy feliz. Razón por lo que desea continuar adelante en el crecimiento de su restaurante. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias, además el préstamo será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Marina, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ingredientes, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevos y demás alimentos para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Marina is 39 years old and lives with his two daughters in a rented home located in Tambo.  For the past four years she has had a restaurant where she prepares the food herself.  Her children help her in serving customers during breakfasts and lunches.  They all rest in the evenings.  She likes her work, now that she has daily food and the dishes she prepares are delicious.  Her secret is the passion with which she makes each dish.

She also likes to cook, although on some occasions she feels tired and the work requires great sacrifice and time.  Her business has grown over time.  She is very happy and wants to continue growing her restaurant.

This will be her fifth loan through MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.
