She also likes being a part of the communal bank because all of the members are united and responsible people.  The loan will also be very helpful toward her financial progress.  Marina will invest the money in ingredients such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, and other things to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana sells peppers and cassava in Elmina. She has been in this business for six years.She is a single parent who is currently taking care of five children.  She is solely responsible for the education, feeding, and clothing of her children. 

Nana's loan will be used to buy more peppers and cassava for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more peppers and cassava for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a baker who has been baking doughnuts, pastries and bread for the past 12 years in Dompoase. She has 5 children and is responsible for their upkeep. Efua will use her loan to buy flour and sugar for her bakery. She plans to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar for her bakery

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
In the picture above is Ekua. She sells maize, rice, loaves of bread, and oil (in the yellow gallons) at Elmina. She is a single parent, currently taking care of five children. Her business has been in existence for six years. 

She will use her loan to buy more foods to resell, like bags of maize and rice, and gallons of oil. Her future plan for her business, is to build a better shop for the business.

loans.use: to buy more foods to resell, like bags of maize and rice, and gallons of oil.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, de 60 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo, pues ya todos sus hijos son independientes. Ellos viven solo en la casa que construyeron hace 40 años. Los terrenos que posee se encuentran en la alturas del valle, donde todos los días desde las primeras horas, sale a cultiva, fertilizar y limpiar, ya que depende mucho de ello el éxito de su cosecha. Ella tiene 38 años de experiencia en la agricultura, gracias a su trabajo constante pudo mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante, “eso es mi orgullo”, afirma. Ahora se encuentra sembrando en mínima escala, pues desea seguir trabajando en el campo, su mayor pasión. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Ullusca” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Alicia, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Alicia, 60 years old, is a hardworking woman. She lives with the company of her husband, now that her children are independent. They live in a house that they built 40 years ago. The land that they own is located in the highlands of the valley, where everyday from the early hours, they go out to cultivate, fertilize, and clean, as the success of their harvest depends greatly on their efforts.

Alicia has 38 years of experience in agriculture. Thanks to her constant work she was able to take care of her children and help them move forward. "That is my pride," she affirms. These days you will find her sowing fields on a small scale, because she desires to continue working in the field, her greatest passion. 

She belongs to the communal bank "Manantiales de Ullusca"  [Springs of Ullusca] and this is the eighth loan with MFP. She is thankful for the financial support offered, as it helps her to improve her business. For this reason, she promises to be punctual with the payment of her quotas. Alicia will invest the money in the purchase of organic fertilizer to spread among her crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and to build a stall to sell his crops.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda, a resident of Kongowea, Coast province, Kenya, is a single mother of three school-going children. Mwenda has owned and operated a food cafe for four years. She sells cooked potatoes, beverages and buns in her stall.

Mwenda learned about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are competition and lack of funds to grow the business. Mwenda is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to purchase cooking pans and food retail stock and to partly pay for her child’s school fees. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's living standard, especially the children's education. Mwenda aspires to own a café in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking pans and retail stock and to partly pay for her child’s school fees.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married businessman living within Malindi, Kenya. He has owned and operated a medical laboratory for the past three years. Emmanuel was previously employed in a clinic before he moved on to open a laboratory.

Emmanuel's challenge of finding additional funds for credit led him to join Milango. He is applying for a loan of 26,300 Kenya shillings to purchase a new microscope. Emmanuel also looks forward to opening a clinic in the near future. He will use the additional income from this loan to renovate the laboratory.

loans.use: To purchase a new microscope.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a single mother of one child who is going to school. 

Peninah owns a retail shop which she has been operating for one year. In this business, Peninah sells flour, milk, cooking oil, toiletries, etc. The family also earns some income from a formal employment with the government.

Peninah learned about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge she is facing is occasional low demand of her stock.

Peninah is applying for a loan of 10700 KES (Kenya shillings) to buy flour, milk, cooking oil, toiletries, and other products. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business and pay for her child’s school fees. She aspires to set up a bookshop, targeting the two schools near her house.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, cooking oil, toiletries, and other products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 62 years old, married, and has one child. She is from Camanga, Tukuran and has been farming for five years, earning an amount of 9,500 PHP per month. 

Recently, Perla joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to pay for labor costs in rice harvesting. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in rice harvesting.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.fr: Seraphine est une dame âgée de 56 ans qui mène comme activité la vente des vivres secs dans un marché de la ville depuis 06 ans déjà. ceci dit elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine, ce qui lui a permit d'avoir une clientèle considérable. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter en gros du maïs, du pistache et du poisson fumé. ce qui est générateur de plus de revenu car pour l'instant elle s'approvisionne en détail. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Seraphine, age 56, has been selling dried foods at a local market for the past six years. She has a solid experience in this activity, which has allowed her to build a substantial customer base. 

She wants to use her loan to buy maize, pistachios and smoked fish wholesale to bolster her income. Until now, she has been buying her stock at retail.  

The revenue earned will help her to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy maize, pistachios and smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is from Militar, Tukuran. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three children. Gena owns and operates a business, a "balut" food stall, in the local community. Gena has been engaged in her business for five years and earns 12,600 PHP a month. 

Gena joined GDMPC in 2008. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more balut food to sell. She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more balut food to sell.

loans.name: Byron Alexander

texts.es: Bayron, tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su hija y su compañera de hogar en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Bayron anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero hace dos años decidió establecer su negocio de pulpería para vender productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, manteca, sal, pastillas, pelotas, harina, churros, refrescos, etc. además tiene un molino de moler maíz cocido para tortillas lo que le genera otros ingresos. el prestamo que ha solicitado por 21,000 Lempiras lo invertira en comprar mas productos y surtir la pulperia para incremnetar las ventas y sus ganancias. El piensa invertir las ganancias para cultivar café, mejorar su vivienda y comprar una motocicleta, y que su familia tenga lo necesario cada día.
texts.en: Bayron, 29, lives with his daughter and housemate in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  Bayron used to work in agriculture but two years ago decided to open his own grocery store to sell food items like rice, beans, sugar, bread, lard, salt, pills, balls, flour, packaged snacks, soft-drinks, etc.  He also has a mill to grind cooked corn for tortillas that generates extra income.  He has requested a 21,000 Lempira loan to buy more products to stock the grocery store to increase sales and profits.  He will invest profits in coffee growing, home improvements, in the purchase of a motorcycle and in seeing that his family has everything needed every day.

loans.use: to stock the store with merchandise.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila, de 43 años es una mujer trabajadora. Tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive en con 2 de ellos, a los que cría sola, pues es madre soltera. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Vivir en el campo es lo que más le gusta, su pasión por la agricultura, sembrar diversas variedades de maíz, papa y habas le gusta mucho. Sus extensas áreas de terreno agrícola el ayudó a salir adelante y forjarse un futuro, pues vende su producción a buen precio. “Hay días en los que pierdo mucho, es por las plagas que azotan el lugar”, comenta. Pero eso no la desanima, sabe que con esfuerzo puede salir adelante, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como 2 toros y 2 vacas que hace poco dieron 2 terneras muy fuertes. Con ello obtiene un dinero extra, pues los vende cuando están maduros. Ahora desea obtener una cosecha buena, ya que viajar a la capital para negociar sus alimentos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Ullusca” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Cirila; invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Cirila is 43 years old and is a hard-working woman. She has four children, but she only lives with two of them. She raised them single-handedly, because she is a single mother. They live together in her own house. 

What she most enjoys is living in the countryside, she has a passion for farming, and really likes sowing different varieties of corn, potatoes and beans.  Her large areas of agricultural land helped her to succeed and build a future, as she gets a good price for the produce she sells. 

“There are days when I make big losses, because of pests that plague the place”, she says. But this doesn't discourage her; she knows that with effort she can get ahead. 

She also makes a living raising young animals such as two bulls and two cows that recently produced two very strong calves. She makes extra money through this, selling them when they are mature. 

Now she wants a good harvest, as she is traveling to the capital city to trade her produce. She belongs to the “Manantiales de Ullusca” community bank, and this is her third loan with MFP. She is grateful for the financial support provided, as it helps her to improve her business. That's why she promises to make her loan repayments on time.

Cirila will use the money to buy organic fertilizer to spread on her crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen tiene 38 años de edad, convive con su esposo en unión libre, tiene 3 hijos, reside junto a su familia en una comunidad del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortes.
Carmen se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ella se motivo a establecer este negocio por la necesidad de generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
Actualmente ha solicitado un crédito por la cantidad de 3000 Lempiras los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de harina de maíz y leña. 
Manifiesta que este financiamiento le ayudara a independizarse de de los vendedores de la harina ya se la han vendido a un costo muy elevado, por lo que dicha materia prima le será más barata.
Agradece mucho a ODEF y KIVA por la confianza depositada en ella y su negocio.
texts.en: Carmen, 38, lives in a free union with her husband; she has three children and lives with her family in a community in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes Department.  Carmen works selling tortillas.  She was motivated to start this business because of the need to generate higher family income.  She’s currently requested a 3,000 Lempira loan to buy corn flour and fire wood.  She states that this loan will help her become independent from flour vendors because they’ve been charging very high prices and this way this raw material will be less expensive.  She is very grateful to ODEF and KIVA for the trust placed in her and her business.

loans.use: to buy corn flour and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coconut to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make and sell viand.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda, 43, is married and has two children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Imelda has managed and operated a retail business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy items such as noddles and milo to sell. Imelda has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. Imelda hopes that her small business will grow and become stable in her village.

loans.use: to buy items such as noddles and milo to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making fruit salad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 33 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos a los que cuida, en la casa que ambos construyeron con mucho sacrificio. Desde niña, su principal actividad económica se centra en la agricultura. Las duras tareas que debe de realizar en la preparación de su terreno agrícola le ayudan a valorar cada día los alimentos que produce, “no es fácil”, comenta. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, maíz trigo y alfalfa. Su mayor motivación son sus hijos, ya que desea brindarles una buena calidad de vida. Por el momento sale todos los días a dedicarse de las tareas del campo. Se siente feliz pues recibe el apoyo de sus hijos quienes cuidan del hogar y de su animales como parte del aprendizaje para la vida, sus esposo trabaja también en el campo y ambos como pareja trabajan para que se pueda dar dentro de unos meses el fruto de su ardua labor que servirá de sostén de la economía familiar. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Ullusca” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Rosa, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus próximos sembrios.
texts.en:
Rosa, 33, is a hardworking woman living with her husband and children who she cares for in the house they both built with much sacrifice.  Since she was a girl, her main economic activity has been agriculture.  The hard chores she has to do to prepare the soil help her value the food produced every day; “it’s not easy,” she comments.  Her main crops are potatoes, corn, wheat and alfalfa.  Her greatest motivation is her children because she wants to give them a good quality of life.  For the moment, she heads out every day to do her work in the fields.  She feels happy because she gets help from her children who as part of the learning process for life take care of the house and watch over the animals.  Her husband also works in the fields and both of them as a couple work so that in a few months the fruits of their hard work will serve as support for the family economy.

She belongs to the “Manantiales de Ullusca” (Ullusca Springs) communal bank and this is the fifth MFP loan.  She’s grateful for the financial support provided because it helps her improve her business.  Because of this, she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  Rosa will use the money to buy organic manure to nourish her next crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Mahugnon 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "MAHUGNON 6" est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sonagnon Madeleine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Sonagnon Madeleine âgée de 59 ans est analphabète. Sonagnon Madeleine est veuve et n'a pas d’enfant. Sonagnon Madeleine vit seule. Il y a près de trente ans que Sonagnon Madeleine exerce comme activité, la vente de nourriture (pâte de maïs et de blé) dans son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Sonagnon Madeleine désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Sonagnon Madeleine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe " MAHUGNON 6 ", un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group MAHUGNON 6 consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Sonagnon Madeleine, seen with her hand raised in the photo. She is a 59-year-old widow without children. She lives alone and is illiterate. 

Sonagnon Madeleine has been selling food (maize and wheat paste) from her home nearly 30 years ago. This allows her to support herself fairly easily. 

To better meet customer demand, Sonagnon Madeleine wishes to bolster her activity. To that end, she and the other members of the group MAHUGNON 6 are seeking a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Huampani Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Las Triunfadoras De Huampani” grupo responsable que pasan a su 4to ciclo y está conformado por 07 socios.  Mariana de 43  años casada y  tiene 02 hijos, la cual sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos. Mariana  comenzó con el negocio de costura hace 20 años, este negocio le permitió apoyar con algunos gastos de su hogar. Con el fin de seguir mejorando emprendió su nuevo negocio de cabinas de internet. Comenzó con 04 maquinas luego compro 02 para implementar mas su negocio. Se siente feliz con todo lo que ha logrado.  Su sueño es comprarse un carro, para su negocio, así poder traer más computadoras. Solicito el crédito para el mantenimiento de sus máquinas. El grupo “Las Triunfadoras De Huampani” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.  Mariana es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste polo color beige.
texts.en: This group is “Las Triunfadoras de Huampani” (Triumphant Ones from Huampani), a responsible group now entering their 4th cycle with seven members.  Mariana, 43, is married and has two children; she still supports one of them.  Mariana started with a sewing business 20 years ago and this business allowed her to help with some of the household expenses.  Aiming at continuing to improve, she started her new Internet access booths business.  She started out with four machines and then bought two more to better equip her business.  She feels happy about everything she’s accomplished.  Her dream is to buy a car for the business so she will be able to bring more computers.  She requested the loan to service the machines.  The “Las Triunfadoras de Huampani” group are grateful for the granted loan because it makes their progress possible.  Mariana is third from the left, wearing a beige shirt.

loans.use: to service computers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora, de 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, está casada con Leni  y junto a él tiene 2 hijos de 25 y 23 años de edad respectivamente, vive en su casa propia junto a toda su familia luchando por salir adelante. El trabajo de Dora consiste en la venta al por menor de productos de primera necesidad, entre los que se encuentran; arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras y mas. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa en donde atiende todos los días y a tiempo completo. Lleva trabajando por 11 años en este rubro. Lleva en este negocio más de 20 años, trabaja sola y por fortuna le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir otras actividades eventuales, afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que siempre tienen clientes debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece y porque además en la única bodega en su barrio, espera poder seguir surgiendo y hacer crecer su negocio. Este es el préstamo número 3 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará mercadería para su venta en su bodega conformada por golosinas, arroz, azúcar, panes, huevos, leche, aceites verduras y otros
texts.en:
Dora, 46 years old, is a hardworking woman and very responsible. She is married to Leni and they have two children 25 and 23 years old respectively. She lives in her own house with her family fighting to get ahead.

Dora’s work consists of selling staples at retail prices, among which are rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, vegetables and more. This business is located in her home and she’s there every day full time. She has been working in this field for eleven years and has been in business for more than twenty. She works alone and fortunately is doing very well.
 
What she likes about her work is that she has time to carry out other activities that come along. Fortunately, it’s going well as she always has clients because of the variety of products that she offers and also because she is the only store in the neighborhood. She hopes to be able to continue advancing and for her business to grow.

This is the third loan through MFP. She is very grateful for the loan opportunity that is offered and for the financial support she needs to get ahead. She promises to make her monthly payments on time and to continue working with a lot of responsibility together with the members of the communal bank. With the amount requested of 1500 soles, she will buy merchandise to sell in her store including sweets, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oils, vegetables and more.

loans.use: to buy sweets, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oil, vegetables, and other items for her store

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 46 лет. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Она очень добрая и трудолюбивая женщина, но судьба у нее очень тяжелая. Ее муж бросил ее с ребенком и не обеспечивает даже своего ребенка. Замире приходится справляться со всеми расходами самой. Трудное условие жизни заставило ее начать бизнес и таким образом найти источник дохода. Уже более 7 лет она занимается переработкой и продажей сухофруктов, как курага. Она летом собирает абрикосы, перерабатывает и продает на местном рынке в виде кураги, а еще часть своего товара она оптом покупает и перепродает. Замира очень вежливо относится клиентам и поэтому у нее много клиентов. Полученный доход от бизнеса она использует для покупки продуктов питания, одежды и образования своего ребенка. Замира хочет развевать бизнес дальше. Она должна купить дополнительый товар для развития бизнеса, однако у нее нет средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки кураги. Она является одной из наших повторных клиентов и имеет хорошее досье. Она ждет вашу доброту и обещает оплатить займ во время.
texts.en: Zamira is 46 years old and has 1 child. She is a very kind and hard-working woman, but her fate has been a difficult one. Her husband left her and their child, and does not provide any child support. Zamira has to manage to meet all expenses on her own. Her tough situation forced her to start her own business as a means of earning an income. For more than 7 years, she has been working in the field of processing and selling dried fruit, such as apricots. In the summer, she picks the apricots, processes them and sells them at the market as dried apricots, and she also sells other fruit that she buys from wholesalers. She is very courteous with her customers, so she has a large clientele. She uses her earnings from the business to pay for her child's food, clothes and education. She now wants to further develop her business. She needs to buy more goods to sell, but she does not have the financial means to do so. Zamira is asking for a loan of 1,500 Tajikistan Somoni to buy dried apricots. She is a repeat borrower of ours and has a good credit history. She is waiting for your kindness and promises to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy dried apricots to develop her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is from Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old, married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Lilibeth has run a general store for 4 years and earns 3,600 PHP each month for these activities. Lilibeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. In 2010, Lilibeth joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and/or to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris es madre soltera, depende de los ingresos que obtiene vendiendo productos de catálogo en diferentes comunidades, quiere ampliar su clientela principalmente porque estamos en una época bastante accesible a este tipo de comercio.
Ella necesita doscientos cincuenta mil colones exactos (250.000) para capital de trabajo (compra de productos)
de esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida, a la vez que hará crecer su negocio
texts.en:
Damaris is a single mother who depends on the income she obtains selling products out of a catalog in various communities. She wants to expand her customer base mainly because we are in a season when this type of business is highly marketable. 

She needs exactly 250,000 colons for working capital (to purchase products). In this way she will make a better income and improve her quality of life, while also growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale by catalog.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 23 años, es una mujer luchadora, amable y muy trabajadora, convive hace 5 años con su pareja William de 28 años con quien tiene una hija de 3 años llamada Jeslyn; por el momento vive en la casa de suegra, lugar en el que comparte junto a su pareja la alegría de educar y criar a su hija y encaminan todos sus esfuerzos y sacrificios para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Elena consiste en la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, aceite, además vende bebidas gaseosas, golosinas, frutas y otros productos. Tiene un espacio en su casa destinado a esta actividad en donde atiende diariamente a sus clientes. Por la tardes instala su puesto de ventas al frente la escuela de la zona en la que vive y ahí se encarga de trabajar durante el recreo hasta la hora de salida de los niños. Considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol que son intensas durante la tarde. Lleva en ésta actividad 7 años, trabaja sola mientras que su pareja trabaja en su mototaxi. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para realizar otras actividades, actualmente desea implementar una tienda mas amplia y con productos de calidad, espera pronto lograr su meta y continuar en la ruta del éxito y la prosperidad por el bien de su familia. Este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2500), comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes conformado por arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos y aceite, también comprará diversas golosinas, frutas y otros productos que consumen los niños, de esta forma espera mantener estable sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Elena is 23 years old. She is a fighting woman, friendly and hardworking. She lives with her husband William, 28 years old and they have a 3 year old daughter called Jeslyn. At the moment she lives in her mother-in-law’s home, a place where she and her husband share the happiness of educating and raising her daughter and putting all their efforts and sacrifices towards providing her a better quality of life.

Elena sells groceries like rice, sugar, milk, eggs, oil, and she also sells soft drinks, sweets, fruits and other products. She has a space in her house for this activity where she serves her customers daily. In the afternoon she has a stand in front of the school in the area where she lives and there she works during recess until the time her children leave. 

She considers the most difficult part of her work having to be under the harsh sun that is so intense in the afternoon. She has been doing this activity for seven years. She works alone while her husband works on his motorcycle taxi. What she likes most about her work is the freedom she has to do other things. Now she wants to implement a more expanded store with quality products. She hopes to soon achieve her goal and continue on the road to success and prosperity for the wellbeing of her family.

This is the eighth loan through MFP, so she is grateful to those who have made her loans possible so she can continue towards her objectives, and on her end she is very committed to once again complete her payments punctually as she did with previous loans she took. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank since all the members are very good, friendly, and supportive.

With the amount requested (2500 soles), she will buy more groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs and oil, and also she will buy various sweets, fruit, and other products that children consume, and this way she hopes to maintain a stable income.

loans.use: to buy sweets, fruits and other products that children consume

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en: Eddy dreams of working in public finance. He currently attends the Universidad San Francisco Xavier but without the ability to purchase the materials he needs to study Eddy feels unsure about how he will manage his final year of school. Furthermore without the opportunity to use a computer and engage with his school subjects on a practical level Eddy does not feel confident about his ability to perform in the job market. Currently Eddy lives at home with his brother, two sisters, and his parents. He has one other sibling who is attending college as well. Their father’s painting salary is not enough to cover their tuition and household expenses so in addition to their school responsibilities they each work 30 hours a week. Eddy makes around $5 a day but with access to the types of accounting jobs his degree could qualify him for, Eddy is expecting to earn around $12 a day. He fears that without the necessary materials to compliments his courses, he will be unable to find a job after he graduates next December. Eddy is passionate about accounting and dreams of a better life for himself and his family.

loans.use: To purchase the school materials he needs to graduate.

loans.name: Geovana

texts.en: Geovana dreams of becoming an engineer. Growing up with a mother who is a college professor, higher education has always been important to Geovana. Without her father to help contribute to the family’s income Geovana and her mother have been struggling to afford all the costs of university and their home expenses. Soon Geovana’s younger brother will be of college age and she hopes he will be able to receive and education as well without delay. In addition to school Geovana works 30 hours a week as a store manager but her income is not enough. Because of the national funding systems in Bolivia, frequently students in technical programs need to pay for the resources they use as part of the curriculum. As an engineering student, this often means extra fees for materials and machine rentals.  Right now Geovana can afford her tuition but is struggling to afford her extra fees and the cost of books and school supplies. With her loan, Geovana plans on purchasing her textbooks and looks forward to being able to save more of her income for her future and her family. Currently she makes around $5 a day, but with training in engineering, she expects to make $14 a day, with this income she expects to be able to make a big impact on her family’s finances and be able to comfortably repay her loan. Engineering is her calling and with this education Geovana plans on helping her society.

loans.use: To pay for her school fees, books and school supplies so that she can graduate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora, is married, age 38, has 4 children, and lives in Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Nora operates a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp while her husband does fishing to earn a living. 

She's been in this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Nora been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Nora wants to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is drawn to medicine for two reasons. He dreams of being able to help people through medicine and is passionate about biology. But also the salary he expects to receive as a trained doctor is incredibly enticing. Currently to afford his school fees, Victor works 30 hours a week and makes around $3.80 a day. Neither of his parents went to college, his mother works as a vendor and his father in construction. With 3 siblings, one of whom is already in university, household finances are extremely tight. Right now, Victor is attending his classes and managing to study without his textbooks. Victor expects that with a career as a doctor he will be able to earn $28 a day. With this kind of income he will be able to not only help his younger siblings attend university but he will be able to save for his own family in the future. With the money from this Vittana loan Victor plans on purchasing the books be needs to excel in his medicine program. Additionally with the extra money a loan will bring in, Victor will be able to focus more of his time on studying. Right now, his part time job frequently conflicts with his university sanctioned internship and often he has to skip his internship in order to work. With this loan Victor feels he will be able to spend more time at his internship cultivating his skills as a doctor and will benefit from it in the end.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees and books so that he can graduate.

loans.name: Paola

texts.en: Paola dreams of becoming a commercial engineer. She is passionate about the field and sees it as a growing opportunity in a growing Bolivia. With a degree in a technical field Paola also dreams of a comfortable future for her family. As the oldest of three, Paola hopes to see her sisters attend college as well. Currently, to help fund her own education Paola works 25 hours a week but makes less than $1 a day. She predicts that will and engineering career she can make $14 a day during her first year. With the funds from this loan she plans on purchasing her books and cutting back on her work hours to focus on school. Without the opportunity for loan she thinks her only option would be to put school on hold while she took up another part time job.

loans.use: To purchase the books she needs to graduate.

loans.name: Evely Lizbets

texts.es:
At 19 years of age, Evely is the principal shopkeeper for her cosmetics store in Nazca, Peru. The home of the famous Nazca Lines, Nazca is a popular tourist destination. She is living at home to help support her family. Her mother inspired her to sell beauty products.

Evely, in addition to her working her shop, is studying in the Nazca Institute to become an official tour guide. She is a very hard worker. She has requested a Kiva loan so that she may purchase a large class showcase for all of her beauty products. She will use the rest of the money to pay for a compulsory school trip which she must complete in order to graduate as a tour guide. In addition to the funds allocated for the trip, she will use her aditional income from the showcase to pay for her studies and support her family. 

Evely aspires to grow her beauty business, even as a tour guide for Nazca. She is very thankful to her Kiva lenders.
texts.en:
At 19 years of age, Evely is the principal shopkeeper for her cosmetics store in Nazca, Peru. The home of the famous Nazca Lines, Nazca is a popular tourist destination. She is living at home to help support her family. Her mother inspired her to sell beauty products.

Evely, in addition to her working her shop, is studying in the Nazca Institute to become an official tour guide. She is a very hard worker. She has requested a Kiva loan so that she may purchase a large class showcase for all of her beauty products. She will use the rest of the money to pay for a compulsory school trip which she must complete in order to graduate as a tour guide. In addition to the funds allocated for the trip, she will use her additional income from the showcase to pay for her studies and support her family. 

Evely aspires to grow her beauty business, even as a tour guide for Nazca. She is very thankful to her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a display case to showcase her products and to pay the expenses of her mandatory school trip.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ledovino

texts.en: Ledovino is a 60-year-old resident of Pagadian City. He provides for his six children from the little amount of 10,000 PHP that he gains monthly from his poultry business which he has had for 30 years. However, this year he joined GDMPC, and is applying for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Ledovino wants to expand his business one day.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.
